loans.name: Carmen Yolanda

texts.es: Carmen vive en el cantón Playas de la provincia del Guayas, tiene 46 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos de 18 años y el otro de 12 años los 2 asisten a un colegio público cerca de su casa. Carmen comenzó hace 10 años atrás en el negocio que es la venta de empanadas. Ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana y prepara las empanadas y se dirige al local a las 8 de la mañana para venderlas. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar verde, aceite y una vitrina para colocar sus empanadas. Su meta es tener un local de venta de comidas típicas ecuatorianas.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the Playas canton in the Guayas province.  She is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  One is 18 years old, and the other is 12 years old, and they both go to a public school close to their house.

Carmen started the business of selling empanadas ten years ago.  She gets up at five in the morning and prepares the empanadas.  She goes to her place at eight in the morning to sell them.

She wants to use the loan to buy cooking oil, green bananas, and a display case in which to put the empanadas.  Her goal is to have a place to sell typical Ecuadorian food.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, green bananas, and a display case in which to put the empanadas.

loans.name: Ana Del Rocio

texts.es: Ana tiene 44 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos los 2  menores asisten a un colegio cerca del sector y el mayor es mayor de edad. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer emprendedora es por eso que dio la apertura a su negocio de venta de cosméticos. Ella trabaja sola de 8 de la mañana hasta la 5 de la tarde.  La forma de trabajo es recorrer diversos lugares de la ciudad ofertando los productos entre amigos y conocidos. Ana  por el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en cuanto a  la delincuencia y espera poder continuar de esta manera. Con el crédito piensa comprar artículos de belleza como labiales, sombras, perfumes, cremas etc. Su sueño es poder tener un local propio de venta de cosméticos
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old. She is married and has 3 children, two of which are high school students and one who is older. Ana has always been an enterprising woman so she decided to open her own business selling cosmetics. She works alone from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. visiting different parts of the city offering her products to friends and acquaintances. So far, Ana has not had any trouble with petty crime while she is selling her products and she hopes to continue doing her business in the same way so that she does not run into problems in the future. 

Ana is requesting this loan in order to buy beauty products such as lipsticks, eyeshadows, perfumes, lotions, etc. Her dream is to one day have her own venue from which to sell her cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as lipsticks, eye shadows, perfumes, lotions, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Vanessa Paola

texts.es: Vanessa tiene 19 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos. Ella comenzó su negocio propio que es la  venta de pollos,  cuando su padre le prestó dinero para que compre pollo y los vende y fue entonces que ella le vende a diferentes tiendas y restaurantes. Ella trabaja sola de lunes a viernes de 8 de las mañana hasta la 3 de la tarde.  Con el préstamo quiere comprar una refrigeradora y pollos para las venta. Su sueño es ser una distribuidora mayorista de pollos
texts.en:
Vanessa is 19 years old. She is single and does not have children. She began her own business selling chicken to various restaurants and stores with start-up money her father lent her to buy chicken. Vanessa works in this business Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator and chicken to sell. Her goal is to become a wholesale chicken vender.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Melba Celinda

texts.es: Melba vive en el sur de Guayaquil en un sector llamado el  Guasmo. Ella comenzó la actividad de corte y confección hace 20 años atrás  estudiando en un curso  eso a ella le encanto, después logro comprarse una máquina de coser. Por lo que ahora ese es su  trabajo ella tiene una maquina en su casa, la cual elabora camisas, pantalones en su taller que con mucho esfuerzo a conseguido .Por eso con el préstamo ella quiere comprar cosas como hilo, tela y una máquina de coser bordadora etc. Su sueño es lograr abrir un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Melba lives in the south of Guayaquil in an area called Guasmo.

She started her sewing business 20 years ago when she took a course, which she loved.  Later she managed to buy a sewing machine.  This is now her work, and she has a sewing machine at her house.  She uses it to make shirts and pants in her workshop, which she got through great effort.

She wants to use the loan to buy things like thread, fabric, and an embroidery sewing machine, etc.  Her dream is to manage to open a sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, and an embroidery sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Yuly Katherine

texts.es: Yuly  vive en la ciudad de  manta provincia de Manabí, tiene 21 años es soltera no tiene hijos. Ella empezó su negocio de venta de ropa hace ya 4 años atrás. Yuly  comenzó con una muy pequeña cantidad de mercancía y ahora cuenta con un stand de ropa. Por lo tanto ella quiere contratar a más empleados para su negocio. Su sueño es expandir su negocio y ofrecer trabajo a personas que no lo tiene. Su meta es ser una muy buena empresaria y abrir  sucursales de venta de ropa en todo el Ecuador.  Con el préstamo, ella va a comprar mercadería  como pantalones, faldas y blusas, Abrigos, shorts etc.
texts.en:
Yuly lives in the city of Manta in the Manabí province.  She is 21 years old, single, and has no children.

She started her business of selling clothes four years ago.  Yuly started with a very small amount of merchandise.  Now she has a clothing stand, and she wants to hire more employees for her business.  Her dream is to expand her business and to offer work to people who do not have any.

Her goal is to be a very good businesswoman, and to open branches selling clothes in all of Ecuador.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like pants, skirts, blouses, coats, and shorts, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, blouses, coats, and shorts, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro vive en el cantón playas de la provincia del Guayas, tiene 50 años de edad es casado tiene hijos que son mayores de edad  por lo que ya son independientes. Su esposa tiene un taller de costura.  El comenzó su taller de reparaciones de vehículo ya hace 30 años atrás, Desde que el era joven trabajaba en talleres mecánicos y fue de ahí de donde aprendió lo que sabe. En la actualidad tiene su propio taller. Con el préstamo quiere comprar repuesto y maquinas, pernos etc. Su sueño es ampliar más su taller para dar una mayor atención a su clientela.
texts.en: Pedro lives in Playas canton, in Guayas province.  He is 50 years old, married, and has adult children who live independently.  His wife has a sewing workshop.  Pedro set up his auto repair shop 30 years ago.  He has worked in auto repair shops since he was young and that is where he learned everything he knows.  He currently has his own workshop.  Pedro would like to use his loan to buy spare parts, machinery, bolts, etc.  His dream is to further expand his workshop so that he can better serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, machinery, bolts, etc.

loans.name: Teresa Maria

texts.es: Teresa vive en el cantón Playas de la provincia del Guayas, tiene 48 años de edad es divorciada tiene 3 hijas 1 un varón pero el único hijo varón falleció hace 3 años . Ella tiene 10 años en el negocio su hijo empezó a realizar pan para vender ya que había aprendido en su último trabajo, entonces ella le ayudaba en el negocio, hace aproximadamente 3 años su hijo murió en un accidente y ahora Teresa es la propietaria del negocio. Siempre recordara a su hijo quien le enseño a administrar el negocio antes de morir. Actualmente ella realiza los panes y pasteles sin problemas una  de sus hijas la ayuda ellas juntas trabajan de martes a domingo desde las 6 e la mañana hasta la 10 de la noche. Con el préstamo quiere comprar un horno, manteca, mantequilla, harina etc. Su meta es tener otros locales y distribuir al por mayor.
texts.en: Teresa lives in Playas canton, in Guayas province.  She is 48 years old, divorced, and has three daughters.  Her only son died three years ago.  Teresa has been in her business for 10 years.  Her son started baking bread to sell as he learned how to do this in his previous job.  Teresa would help him in the business.  Approximately three years ago, Teresa's son died in an accident and now she owns the business.  She will always remember her son who taught her how to run the business before he died.  Teresa currently prepares her bread and cakes without any problems as one of her daughters helps her.  They work together from Tuesday to Sunday, from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  Teresa would like to use her loan to buy an oven, lard, butter, flour, etc. Her goal is to have additional premises and to distribute her goods wholesale.

loans.use: to buy an oven, lard, butter, flour, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maritza

texts.es: Ana tiene 52 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos que son mayores de edad ya  que no viven con ella porque son independientes. Su esposo emigro a los Estados Unidos en busca de trabajo. y fue ahi cuando Ana comenzo a trabajar y fue entonces que  comenzó  vendiendo leche de soya en la calles a ella  siempre le ha gustado el comercio es por eso que ahora se dedica a crear artículos decorativos para el hogar son trabajos manuales  que realiza. Ella trabaja todos los días desde la 9 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde y los fines de semana los vende  .Con el préstamo comprara materiales para sus manualidades. Sus aspiraciones a futuro es viajar a los estados unidos para encontrarse con su esposo y al llegar alla abrir un negocio propio
texts.en:
Ana is 52 years of age, married and has two children who are grown and do not live with her because they are independent. Her husband emigrated to the United States to look for work and that was when Ana went to work selling soy milk as a street vendor. She has always enjoyed commerce and so now she earns a living creating decorative items for the home. These are handcrafted items that she makes. She works every day from 9 a.m. until 4 p.m. and sells her work on the weekends. 

With the loan she will purchase materials for her handcrafted items. Her aspirations for the future are to travel to the United States to be with her husband and open her own business once she gets there.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her handcrafts.

loans.name: Amada Sonia

texts.es: Amada tiene 36 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos el varón tiene 17 años y la menor tiene 12 años ambos asisten a un colegio público cerca de su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene su negocio propio  de venta de helados casero. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo. Ellos juntos salen a vender los helados  de  lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde en la calles ofertándolos entre amigos y vecinos. Con el crédito quiere comprar helados y arreglar su casa. Su meta es abrir otro negocio y quiere que sea una tienda de víveres  en general
texts.en:
Amada is 36 years of age, married and has two children. Her son is 17 years of age and the younger daughter is 12. Both attend a public school near their house. Currently she has her own business selling homemade ice cream. She works with her husband. The two of them go out together to sell the ice cream Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. on the streets, selling to friends and neighbors. 

With the loan she wants to purchase ice cream and fix up her house. Her goal is to open another business and she wants it to be a general food store.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream and fix up her house.

loans.name: Landy

texts.es:
Landy es una mujer de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus pequeños; lamentablemente Landy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear con sus pequeños  por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Tacacho con Pollo Frio, el cual es el palto favorito de su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Landy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pescado, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella realiza sus ventas de forma ambulatoria, puede trabajar un aproximado de 6 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Landy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del alquilar de un pequeño puesto de ventas en un mercado de su ciudad; de esta manera Landy espera mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para cumplir sus metas y lograr su sueño de tener propia casa.
texts.en:
Landy is a 23 years old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her two small children, who she loves and considers to be her primary reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates herself fully to helping her family to get ahead in life, especially since she acts as both father and mother to her children, sadly.  Landy was not able to study at the university level, but she would have really liked to study the law.  In her free time, she likes to go walking with her children through the warm and narrow streets of her city, and sometimes she cooks a dish of delicious Tacacho (chopped and roasted plantains) with cold chicken, which is a favorite meal in her family.

By her own initiative, and with a great deal of effort and dedication, Landy works at a small business that sells fish, every day she starts work very early in the morning, and she works on foot.  She works up to about 6 hours each day, and she thinks it is going well because of the kind attention that she gives to her customers.

Landy is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that she will be able to cover the costs of renting a small market stall in one of the marketplaces in her city.  In this way, Landy hopes to improve her business and increase her sales.  Therefore, she will be able to continue working and striving to meet her goals and achieve her dream of having a house of her own.

loans.use: to cover the costs of renting a storefront.

loans.name: Raquel  Marlene

texts.es: Raquel vive en la ciudad de Quevedo de la provincia de Los Ríos, tiene 34 años de edad es divorciada tiene 4 hijos que asisten a una escuela pública del sector. Ella siempre quiso tener su negocio propio es por eso que hace algunos años atrás ella recorría vendiendo morocho en calles pero con el préstamo anterior se compro su carreta y ahora tiene un puesto de venta de morocho. Ella trabaja sola de lunes a domingo  de 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche .Con el prestamo quiere comprar ollas y ingredientes del morocho. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo para poder darle una mejor vida  sus hijos
texts.en: Raquel lives in the city of Quevedo in the province of Los Ríos.  She's thirty-four and divorced with four children who go to a local public school.  She always wanted to have her own business. A few years back she was traveling around selling morocho [a drink made of milk and corn] on the streets, but then, with her prior loan, she bought a cart and now she has a morocho stand.  She works by herself seven days a week from five in the morning til ten at night.  She wants to use this loan to buy pots and ingredients for making morocho.  Her dream is for the business to keep growing so she can give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy pots and ingredients to make morocho [a drink made of milk and corn].

loans.name: Maria Yinelli

texts.es: María tiene 22 años de edad es madre soltera  tiene 1 hijo de 2 años. Ella comenzó su negocio a raíz  de la separación del padre de su hijo. En la actualidad María tiene un bazar. Ella  Atiende su pequeño negocio sola. Ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 8.00am hasta las 10.00pm. Ella cuenta que al principio su zona era de mucha delincuencia y no había mucha productividad para su negocio  pero poco a poco ha ido mejorando esas condiciones pues ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio y su sueño es ampliarlo más para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores que dio a día le compran en su bazar. Su sueño  es arreglar su vivienda y terminar la carrera universitaria para así poderle dar un  futuro mejor  para su hijo. Con el préstamo quisiera comprar artículos para el bazar, papeles, láminas,  etc.
texts.en:
María is 22 years old and a single mother, with one child who is 2 years old.  She began her business as a result of her separation from the father of her child.  María currently runs a small stationery shop.  She is the only worker in her store, so she works from 8:00am until 10:00pm.

She says that in the beginning, her area was full of petty crime and there was very little business for her shop, but little by little these conditions have improved and now things are going quite well in her business, and her dream is to expand her offerings to satisfy the needs of her customers who come to shop at her store each day. Her dream is to make repairs to her house and finish her university career to give a better life to her child.  With this loan, she plans to buy items for her shop, such as paper, stickers, etc.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop, like papers, stickers, etc.

loans.name: Francia Mariuxi

texts.es: Francia tiene 33 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos que asisten a una escuela pública. Ella empezó en el trabajo como  comerciante ya que vio la  necesidad de que no podía conseguir un trabajo. En la actualidad ella vende junto  su esposo ropa, pantalones. Ellos trabajan juntos de lunes a domingo desde la 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Con el crédito va a comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, shorts etc. Su sueño es tener un almacén grande para que así sus ventas incrementen y darle un buen bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Francia is 33 years old, is married and has 2 children who go to a public school. She started her sales business out of need as she couldn't get a job. Now she sells clothes, like trousers, along with her husband. They work together Monday through Sunday from 8 in the morning to 5 in the evening. 

With the loan, she is going to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts, shorts, etc. Her dream is to have a large shop so that her sales will increase and her family can have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Teodora Lucia

texts.es: Teodora tiene 31 años de edad es casada tiene 1 hija que estudia en una escuela pública. Su esposo es maestro albañil. Teodora empezó con el sueño de tener su salón de belleza propio y lo consiguió. En la actualidad ella tiene su salón de belleza la cual corta el cabello realiza tinturado de cabello. Ella trabaja sola de lunes sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Con el préstamo Teodora comprara un sillón y productos como tinte agua oxigenada, tijeras etc. Su sueño es construir su casa y arreglar su local
texts.en:
Teodora is 31 years old, married, and has a daughter that is studying in a public school. Her husband is a master mason. Teodora began with the dream of having her own beauty salon and she achieved it. Nowadays she has her beauty salon in which she cuts and dyes hair. She works alone from Monday to Saturday from 8 A.M. until 9 P.M.

With the loan, Teodora will buy a chair and products like hair dye, hydrogen peroxide, scissors, etc. Her dream is to build her house and fix up her business.

loans.use: to buy a chair and products like hair dye, hydrogen peroxide, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Solanda Piedad

texts.es: Solanda tiene 44 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos el mayor estudia en una escuela cercana a su casa y el menor es muy pequeño por lo que no estudia. Ella comenzó su negocio a raíz  de la separación del padre de su hijo. En la actualidad Solanda tiene un bazar. Ella  Atiende su pequeño negocio sola. Ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 8.00am hasta las 10.00pm. Ella cuenta que al principio su zona era de mucha delincuencia y no había mucha productividad para su negocio  pero poco a poco ha ido mejorando esas condiciones pues ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio y su sueño es ampliarlo más para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores que dio a día le compran en su bazar. Su sueño  es arreglar su vivienda y darle un  futuro mejor  para su hijo. Con el préstamo quisiera comprar artículos para el bazar, papeles, láminas,  etc.
texts.en:
Solanda is 44 years old and a single mother with two children.  The older one goes to school at a place near their home, and the younger is very small and therefore doesn't yet attend school.  She began a business at the time that she separated from the children's father.  She currently runs a small variety shop.  She runs her business by herself and she works from 8:00am until 10:00pm.  

She says that in the beginning, her area was full of petty crime and there was very little business for her shop, but little by little these conditions have improved and now things are going quite well, and her dream is to expand her offerings to satisfy the needs of her customers who come to shop at her store each day.  Her dream is to make repairs to her home and give her child a better future.  With this loan, she hopes to buy more goods for her shop, like paper, stickers, etc.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop, like papers, stickers, notebooks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Maribel

texts.es: María tiene 36 años de edad es casado tiene 2 hijos el mayor  no vive con ella por lo que ya es independiente y el menor estudia en un colegio público. Su esposo es un mecánico. Inicio su negocio de venta de viveres hace 3 años atrás con una vitrina y una percha. Debido a la demanda de los víveres el comenzó a comprar arroz y aceite, poco a poco con esfuerzo y algunos sacrificios ahora trabaja en su propio negocio la cual es la venta de víveres en general. Ella Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta el anochecer. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, enlatados, azúcar etc. En el futuro quiere  agrandar más su tienda para ofrecer una mayor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and married, with two children who have come of age and no longer live with her because they are independent and the younger one is studying at a public college.  Her husband is a mechanic.  She began her grocery store about three years ago with just one glass cabinet and a shelf.  

Because of the demand for grocery goods, she began buying rice and oil, and little by little, through her efforts and some sacrifices, she now works at her own business and sells all kind of groceries.  She works from 6:00 in the morning until sundown.  With this loan, she wants to buy foods like rice, canned goods, and sugar, etc.  In the future, she wants to expand her business and offer more options to her customers.

loans.use: to buy groceries like rice, canned goods, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Albertina Holanda

texts.es: Albertina tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil divorciada, tiene 1 hija en una escuela pública. Empezó trabajando como enfermera ella les aplica las  inyecciones a sus vecinos. Gracias al primer crédito que solicito dio la apertura a su negocio que es una farmacia. En la actualidad trabaja medio dia como enfermera  y la otra mitad del día la dedica a su negocio. Con el crédito Albertina comprara Pastillas, pañales, jarabes,jabones etc. Su meta es ampliar su farmacia ya que así podrá dar una mayor atención a su clientela y por lo consecuente aumentara sus ventas y poderle dar un buen futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Albertina is 45 years old. She is divorced and has one daughter who is currently studying in a nearby public school. Albertina began working as a nurse, administering injections to her neighbors. Thanks to her previous loan, she was able to open a pharmacy. Currently, Albertina works half-time as a nurse and half-time in her pharmacy.

Now, Albertina is requesting a loan to buy medicines, diapers, syrups, soaps, etc. Her goal is to expand her pharmacy and be able to better attend to her customers. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales and offer a better future to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy medicines, diapers, syrups, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Angelica Nathaly

texts.es: Angélica vive en el suburbio de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Tiene 21 años de edad es casada tiene una hija de 2 meses  de nacida. Ella desde que se caso, su sueño era tener un negocio propio y vio la oportunidad ya que  su madre trabaja en los Estados Unidos  le pudo pedir prestado  prestado  un dinero y fue ahí que dio la apertura a su negocio la cual es la venta de comida rápidas, Ella se compro una carreta y ahora vende comida en la esquina de su casa. Ella trabaja sola de jueves a domingo desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche. Con el crédito comprara  pollos, carne, embutidos, mesas, sillas etc. Su meta es tener un restaurante de comidas típicas del Ecuador.
texts.en: Angélica lives in the suburbs of the city of Guayaquil.  She's twenty-one and married with a two-month-old daughter.  Since she got married, her dream has been to have her own business.  She saw that there was opportunity because her mother works in the United Stated.  Maria was able to get a loan, which she used to open up her fast food stand.  She bought a cart and now sells food at the corner by her house.  She works by herself Thursday through Sunday from four in the afternoon until eleven at night.  She plans to use this loan to buy chickens, meat, sausages, tables, chairs, etc.  Her goal is to have a restaurant offering typical Ecuadoran food.

loans.use: to buy chickens, meat, sausage, tables, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José, tiene 34 años de edad, es de una familia humilde compuesta de cinco varones y tres mujeres, de escasos recursos económicos, por lo tanto cultiva superficies muy pequeñas. Vive en la comunidad de Yunguillas Alta del municipio de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura  y la pecuaria desde hace 16 años produce y comercializa papa, frejol y arveja para la alimentación de su familia el excedente los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. El señor José es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la educación y el bienestar de toda su familia. El señor José, necesita para para construir su vivienda, por ser una familia numerosa necesita ambientes y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
José, 34, is from a modest family of five males and three females.  He has few economic resources so he cultivates very small pieces of land.  He lives in the community of Yunguillas Alta in the town of Mizque in the department of Cochabamba.  He has worked in agriculture and livestock for 16 years.  He grows and sells potatoes, beans, and peas to feed his family, and sells the rest to the merchants in the same community, Mizque.

José is a very respected person in his community because of his dedication to his job and for being responsible for the education and well-being of his whole family.

José needs a loan to build his house.  Because they're a large family, he needs rooms to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita  es una  mujer  de 67 años muy trabajadora que desde hace más de quince años se dedica a la Costura  de Ropa  la señora  enviudo hace un año por lo que tuvo que invertirle mas tiempo a su negocio ya que antes del fallecimiento de su esposo ella veia el negocio  como un pasatiempo y un ingreso extra,  ahora cuenta con la pensión que le dejo su esposo pero apenas y le alcanza para despensa y algunos gastos de la casa , por lo que solicito el crédito para comprar telas y material que ocupa en su negocio para elaborar ropa y sueters ya que se presenta temporada de invierno y asi incrementará sus ventas e  ingresos y sus clientes estarán satisfechos con su variedad de ropa.
texts.en:
Señora Benita is a hard working 67 year old woman who has worked as a seamstress for more than 15 years. She became a widow a year ago, which is why she had to invest more time into her business. Before her husband died she saw the business as a hobby and an extra income. Now, she has the small pension her husband left her, which is just enough for food and some household bills.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy cloth and materials to use in her business sewing clothes and sweaters. As winter is here, she will be able to increase her sales and income, and her customers will be satisfied with the variety of clothes.

loans.use: to buy cloth and materials.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen,  tiene 64 años de edad, está separada hace varios años y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad y solo uno de ellos vive con ella.

Doña Carmen para salir adelante ya está sola se dedica a preparar y vender comida, ella tiene un restaurante en el centro de la ciudad en el cual prepara deliciosos platos que son de mucho agrado de sus clientes, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 5h00 hasta las 14h00 y los sábados y domingos desde las 4h00 hasta las 20h00, trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo. Sus clientes la prefiere porque cocina delicioso y su especialidad es el pescado hornado.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para la preparación de sus deliciosos platos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local más amplio y tener salud ante todo.
texts.en:
The “Salud y Vida” (Health and Life) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and also for being just a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.  Carmen, 64, lives here.  She’s been separated for several years and has six children who are all adults now; only one of them still lives with her.

In order to get ahead since she’s alone, she works making and selling food.  She has a restaurant downtown where she prepares her delicious dishes that are highly enjoyed by her customers.  She works Monday through Friday from 5am until 2pm and on Saturday and Sunday from 4am until 8pm.  Her son helps her with the work.  Her customers prefer her because her cooking is delicious; her specialty is oven-baked fish.

She will use this loan to buy foodstuffs used in her delicious dishes.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is to have a more spacious locale and above all to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Betty Cesilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10, 6 y de 3 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una piladora de arroz.

Doña Betty con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a solventar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un negocio en la casa de los suegros, vende CD y repuestos de carros desde llantas hasta repuestos eléctricos, su negocio lo tiene desde hace tres años, trabaja sola todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar repuestos para carros. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de cinco años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The Salud y Vida [Life and Health] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto, which is known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes away from San Jacinto and San Clemente, the best beaches in the province.

Here lives Betty, who is thirty-one and lives with her partner with whom she has three children, ten-, six-, and three-years-old.  The two older children are in school.  Betty's partner works in a rice mill.  

In order to make money and pay for her children's schooling, Betty has her own business in her in-laws' house, selling CDs and everything from spare parts for cars, to tires, to electronics spare parts.  She's had the business for three years, and works by herself every day from 8AM until 6PM.  

Betty plans to use her loan to buy car spare parts.  She's been with the communal bank for more than five years and she likes it because the loan process is quick and doesn't have too many requirements.

Her dream is to have her own house because now she lives in her in-laws' house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Barbara Fredesbinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí vive la señora Bárbara, tiene 54 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen 4 hijos los mismos que ya son  mayores de edad, uno de   ellos aun viven en su casa, también vive con ella una nieta de 8 años que es como su hija y estudia en la escuela. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Doña Barbara junto a su  familia se dedican a la agricultura, siembran en toda época del año ya que el terreno que tienen se presta para esto,  siembran maíz y verduras como habas, habichuelas, etc. dependiendo de la época del año. Trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las 7h00 hasta las 14h00.  Cuando llega el tiempo de cosecha su esposo recoge los cultivos y los lleva a entregar al mercado de Tosagua o vende a los comerciantes llegan hasta su sembrío.

Este crédito es para pagar la mano de obra ya que tiene que limpiar la maleza del terreno porque que se acerca el invierno y quieren sembrar mucho mas este año. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 7 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa de cemento ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The “Salud y Vida” (Health and Life) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and also for being just a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.  Bárbara, 54, lives here.  She’s in a free union and has four children who are all adults now; one of them still lives at home.  An 8-year-old granddaughter who is like her own daughter and is attending school also lives with her.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Bárbara and her family work in agriculture.  They plant year-round because the land they have is apt for this; they grow corn and vegetables like lima beans, kidney beans, etc. depending on the season of the year.  They work Monday through Friday from 7am until 2pm.  When it’s harvest time, her husband collects the harvests and takes them to the market in Tosagua or sells them to merchants who come to his fields.

 This loan is to pay labor costs because weeding has to be done because winter is approaching and they want to plant much more this year.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for 7 years and likes it because the loans are quick.  Her dream is to have a cement house because the one she has is made of sugarcane stalks.

loans.use: to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Fátima Susana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Fátima tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijas de 11 y 9 años las últimas son mellizas. Su esposo es supervisor de obra en una empresa constructora.

Doña Fátima con la finalidad de obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica  a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad al cual muchas personas acuden cuando lleva mercadería nueva y los fines de semana que son los días de feria, trabaja todos los días desde las  desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 solo los domingos trabaja hasta el medio día, la ropa usada la compra en Portoviejo en una distribuidora y lo que es ropa nueva la compra en Guayaquil ya que allá le venden a mejor precio y hay más variedad, lleva más de 8 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 4 años y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan con los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir en su negocio y tener un local propio ya que donde ella vende es de su hermana.
texts.en:
The “Salud y Vida” (Health and Life) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and also for being just a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.  Fátima, 40, lives here.  She’s married and has three daughters who are 11 and 9 years old; the youngest are twins.  Her husband is a job supervisor for a construction firm.

In order to earn income of her own to help cover household expenses, Fátima sells new and used clothes.  She has a locale downtown that many people come to when she brings new merchandise and on weekends which are market days.  She works every day from 8am until 6pm and only on Sunday works a half-day.  She buys the used clothes in Portoviejo from a supplier and the new clothes in Guayaquil which is where the best prices and more variety are; she’s been in business 8 years and does very well.

She will use this loan to buy all types of clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for 4 years and likes it because of the help the loans always provide.  Her goal is to stay in business and own her own shop because where she currently sells belongs to her sister.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Andrea Piedad

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Andrea, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que el gusta valerse por sí misma y ganarse sus propios ingresos, se dedica a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo, sandalias y perfumes, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana sobre todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora uno de sus hijos está en la escuela y es más fácil llevarle solo al más pequeño, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, tiene muchos clientes y lleva más de 5 años con su negocio. Sus productos los compra en Guayaquil y Santo Domingo cada vez que necesita.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar ropa, perfumes y sandalias. Lleva más de tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
The “Salud y Vida” (Health and Life) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and also for being just a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.  Andrea, 23, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 5 and 3 years of age; the oldest attends school and her husband’s a merchant.

She is a very hardworking young woman who likes to fend for herself and earn her own income.  She sells all types of clothes, sandals and perfume door to door.  She works three days a week especially in the morning which is when one of her children is in school and it’s easier to just take the youngest one along.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She has many customers and has been in business five years.  She buys her items in Guayaquil and in Santo Domingo as needed.

She will use this loan to buy clothes, perfume and sandals.  She’s been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because the loans make it possible for her to finance her business.  Her dream is to have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothes, pefume and sandals.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim is 49 years old and married. Her family resides in Pursat province, Kror Kor district, in Cambodia. She is blessed with six children. Some of her children are students and still under her responsibility while the others have their own employment. 

To support her family, Sarim has a business farming rice and raising pigs, earning around 20,000KHR and saving approximately 10,000KHR after deducting her daily cost of living. Sarim’s husband also makes palm juice in order to earn extra income for the family. 

Sarim is a second-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan helped her guarantee food security for her family as well as improve her family’s livelihood. Sarim is requesting a KHR 3,000,000 loan. She plans on utilizing some of her loan to purchase more pigs to raise and feed for her pigs. The other portion of the loan will be spent on buying a bamboo ladder to support her husband’s business. 

After receiving this loan and wisely using it, Sarim will be so excited and can not wait to see the improvement in her current business as well as her husband’s business, which leads to more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Sinon's Group

texts.en:
Sinon, 38, is a rice farmer in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia. She has three children, all of whom are dependent on her and they are still in school in the local area.

She has been selling grocery items and clothes for 11 years. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day. After daily expenses, she manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Sinon has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sinon completely repaid the loans, which have helped her to send her children to school. 

Now she and her fellow group member would like to request another loan of KHR 1,200,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items and clothes for resale and use a portion of it to buy household supplies. Through this loan, she hopes to earn a large income for the family so as to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items and clothes for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lorn's Group

texts.en:
Lorn, 52, is a villager in a rural area of Sangke district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. He is married and has six children. One son is a student and still dependent on him. 

Lorn and his wife make their living by farming rice. To add more income to the family, his wife also has a cattle-raising business. 

This is Lorn’s third time requesting a loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Lorn is really thankful for the previous loans, which he has already obtained and successfully paid back, because via the help of those loans he has been able to improve his family’s livelihood and send his son to school. 

Now he is in need of money to purchase fertilizer to support his farmland. Thus, he is leading a group of two members to apply for a loan in the amount of 900,000 KHR each. After receiving his loan portion, Lorn has high expectations that his business will provide a good-quality crop so that he can sell it for greater income and use the anticipated income to expand his business as well as advance his son’s education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Earnn's Group

texts.en:
Earnn is a 55-year-old married mother who lives with her husband and seven children in a rural area of Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Out of her seven children, she still has one child to care for who is still in school. To support the family, Earnn farms rice and plants vegetables while her husband supplements the income by raising pigs and catching fish. They have been in this business for twenty-one years. Her family's daily income is approximately 25,000 KHR and they can manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after their daily expenses.

Earnn’s group consists of two female members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. Earnn completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to support her child’s education and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,300,000 KHR each. Earnn is going to use her portion to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs in order to sell them for a good price to better her living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for raising

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
A resident residing in a rural area of Dambae district in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Mao is 26 years of age and married with two dependent children, both of whom are school-aged children. This industrious woman, Mao, supports her family by planting cassava and selling some grocery items in order to complement the income. 

Mao is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a KHR 1,000,000 loan. With this first-time requested loan, Mao plans on paying wages to farm laborers and purchasing more grocery items for resale such as sugar, salt, canned items, etc. 

Mao believes that her family’s livelihood will be improved via the help of this loan and, most importantly, she will be able to offer her children a bright future by advancing their education further.

loans.use: To pay wages to farm laborers

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy is age 25 and married with two dependent children, who are still under school-age. Her family lives in a rural area of Ponhea Krek District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, Vy has been planting cassava and selling grocery items for seven years, and her husband also contributes income by working for others for a fee in the local area. The current businesses earn her approximately 28,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Vy has been a member of VisionFund for one loan cycle and fully repaid the loan. She has wisely and successfully used her previous loan to better support her family. Now she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to pay for labor expenses in her farming business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living and fulfill her dream of having a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To pay for labor expenses in farming business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is a 35-year-old married mother. She has two children who are still in school. Phalla is living in a wooden house in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. 

For 15 years she has been planting cassava and rubber on a two-hectare area of farmland as the main sources of her family’s income. Her daily income is approximately US $11 per day, and she manages to save about US $5 each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

This is Phalla's first microloan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to buy rubber seedlings for her rubber-planting business. She hopes to grow her rubber and cassava healthfully and timely so as to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rubber seedling for rubber-planting business.

loans.name: Thou's Group

texts.en:
Thou is a resident living in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia. She is a 28-year-old married woman with one dependent son who is a student. 

Thou supports her family by working as a rice farmer and paid worker, earning around 17,000 KHR per day and saving approximately 7,000 KHR after deducting her daily cost of living. 

Thou, a second-time borrower, is leading a group of three members to take out a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR in total. The group representative, Thou comments that the previous loan she obtained and successfully paid back has enabled her to improve her family’s living conditions. 

Thou will spend her requested loan portion in this loan, which is 1,000,000 KHR, on buying fertilizer to apply to her farmland and buying study materials such as books, pen, pencil, bag, ruler, etc., for her son. 

After receiving her requested loan portion and wisely using it, Thou hopes that the rice-growing business will provide good quality crop yields and her family’s living standard will improve even more.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, a 30-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two children to take care of, and they are in school. 

To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting peppers for three years, and she also makes and sells grocery items in the village. Her family's income is about 32,000 KHR per day and Sophea can manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Sophea has been with VisionFund for one cycle and successfully paid back the past loan, which has helped her improve her family's living conditions. Now she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer for her plantation business. She hopes to grow her pepper and rice more healthfully and fruitfully so as to sell them for a good price to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Savat is a 47-year-old rice farmer who lives with her husband in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has eleven children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To support her big family, Savat has been growing rice on one hectare of farmland while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to earn additional income. Having been in this occupation for almost 30 years, they are able to earn almost 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.

Savat has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and fully paid back the past loan. She has wisely used the previous loan to better support her family's living conditions. 

Savat is asking for another loan with VisionFund of 2,000,000 KHR. She is going to use her portion to repair her hand tractor machine. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To repair her hand tractor machine.

loans.name: Mi's Group

texts.en:
Mi, a 34-year-old local farmer from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, is one of the breadwinners in a family with three children. Two of her children are still in school while the third is helping in the family business. She can overcome her family's hardship from her income of about 12,000 KHR per day from her rice-cropping business on one hectare of farmland. 

Including this cycle, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has managed her previous loans, which she has completely paid back, in a wise manner, providing sufficient and decent food for her children and living in a hygienic condition. 

Now, she is the leader in a group of five members seeking a new loan. The total amount of her entire group loan is 4,400,000 KHR. Mi's loan portion, which is 1,400,000 KHR, will be used to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop and to buy pigs for raising as extra income. She believes that she can improve her crop output, so she can make more profit to support her household, especially her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pigs.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 25 years old and married. She resides in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

To support the family, she has been farming rice and planting vegetables for several years, while her husband helps to earn extra income for the family by working for others for a fee. Chantha and her husband can earn approximately US $8 per day and manage to save about US $3 each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Chantha has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle. The past loan, which she successfully paid back, has relieved her family’s burden and also built on her savings for future needs. 

Now she would like to acquire a loan of US $400 from VisionFund. Chantha will use this loan to buy piglets for raising to earn additional income to better support her family. She hopes to earn more income from her pig business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Pursat province of Kror Kor district, Mom is a 39-year-old mother who has five children. Two of her children mainly need her support as they are still in school; one is in grade 10 and another is in grade 8. 

Her primary sources of income are from one and half hectares of rice cultivation and a pig-raising business. She has engaged in this business for 19 years and earns about 12,500 KHR per day. 

Mom has never been with VisionFund before. She formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. She and one of her co-members are newly joined borrowers seeking 1,000,000 KHR each, while the third member is a third-cycle loan client who is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. 

With her loan portion, Mom is going to buy pig's feed and fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes earn more income from her current business so that she can improve her standard of living as well as keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pig's feed and fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Ry is 27 years old and a mother of a young child. Ry and her husband provide for their family through their rice-growing business. During their spare time, this couple also works for others for a fee for extra income. They are able to earn only 6,900 KHR per day from their current business. 

Ry, in a group of two, is in the first cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She is requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR, while her co-member is applying for 300,000 KHR. She is going to use her portion of the loan to fix her house by buying zinc sheets to wall up her house. She hopes to be able to fix her house in time for her children. 

This way, she can pay more attention to generating more income.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets to wall up her house.

loans.name: Ngun's Group

texts.en:
Ngun, originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is a mother of three children.  She is 55 years old and makes a living growing rice on two and half hectares.  With 25 years of experience in this business, she is able to earn up to 19,400 Riels (KHR) per day.  Her main challenge is the lack of working capital for buying fertilizer to boost her farm's yield. 

Ngun's group is composed of two female members; she is a second-time borrower and her co-borrower is a first-time borrower.  She has paid back her previous loan with success in improving her lifestyle as well as supporting her business better than before.  

She is requesting 1,200,000 KHR and her fellow group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR.  Ngun is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops.  She hopes to double her crop production and improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Chanly's Group

texts.en: A young married woman from Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Chanly is 19 years old and a rice farmer.  She has one child, who is still young, to support.  Chanly is the leader of a group of four first-time borrowers.  Each member in the group is applying for the same loan amount of 1,000,000 Riels (KHR).  Chanly is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland.  She hopes to mount up her production so as she can set aside some money in order to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Chamroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Chamroeurn, a 49-year-old diligent local farmer from Battambang Province's Moung Russey district, is married and has five children.  She has tried hard to deal with her family's hardship via chili-growing while her husband also helps to earns extra income catching fish to sell.

Her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) was the previous loan which she has completely paid back.  Her past loan has helped her improve her living conditions as well as better support her business.  Now, she is able to earn almost 31,000 Riels (KHR) per day.  To keep up a good movement of her business, she formed a group of three to seek a new loan.  She is a second-time borrower and seeking 500,000 KHR while the other two group members are applying for 700,000 KHR each.  

For Chamroeurn as the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for cash crops.  Part of her loan will be used to purchase white bean seeds for growing as additional income.  She hopes this purchase will increase her yield and return her a good margin.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for a cash crop

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som lives in the Battambang Province's Thmor Koul district, where rice farming is the common primary business to generate income for the villagers, as well as for Som. She is 30 years old and is a mother of two schoolchildren. She and her husband grow rice in order to support the entire family. During their free time, the couple catches fish and works for others for a fee for additional income. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Som, who has never been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before, is requesting a new loan cycle as a first-time borrower. She will spend her loan on purchasing rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline and to pay for plowing. She hopes to increase the output, so she can also earn more profit in order to keep her children in school until tertiary level, as well as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer, gasoline, and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Laem's Group

texts.en:
Laem is 27 years old, married and a mother of two children who are still students in the local public school. She and her husband grow corn on their own hectare of farmland for a living. During their spare time, Laem and her husband work as paid workers to earn additional income. With two years of experience in corn-planting, she is able to earn 22,000 KHR and can save only 7,000 KHR per day. 

Laem's group consists of four female members and they have just joined VisionFund for this loan cycle in order to apply for a first-cycle loan. As the leader, Laem is going to use her portion to buy seed, fertilizer and insecticide for her corn field. She hopes to receive a good yield and sell with high profit, so she can build on her savings to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
A 36-year-old resident from Sangke district of Cambodia, Sopheak is one of the wage earners in the family consisting of four children who are still in school.  For her, animal husbandry (cows and chickens) is the primary source of her family's income, from which she is able to earn about 23,000 Riels (KHR) per day.  She has engaged in this business for 5 years.  

Sopheak has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for ages, having had five loans; she has fully paid back her loans with success.  Her past loans have supported her living condition better than before plus expanded her business. 

Now, she has formed a group of three to seek a new loan.  She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each whereas the remaining female member is seeking for 1,200,000 KHR.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy chicken feed.  She hopes to fatten her chickens in a healthy condition; hence she can make more income and keep all of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Chola's Group

texts.en: Chola, a rural citizen living in the Sangke district of Cambodia, is 39 years old and a mother of four children.  Currently, only one daughter is under her dependency as she is a student.  She has managed the daily basic needs in her household from selling grocery items at home.  She has engaged in this business for 10 years.  Chola is the leader of a group of two as first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner).  Both of them are applying for 1,000,000 Riels (KHR).  Chola is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to resell.  She hopes this purchase will help her to replenish her products on time and make more income for her family's sake as well as to keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Khanga Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her early twenties, is married and has a child who goes to school. She has been running a clothes shop for two years now. She works from 8 am to 7 pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a plot which she wishes to build a house on someday, bought a TV, a fridge, a cupboard, a dressing table, covered household expenses and has paid back all her loans successfully. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her dream is to someday be able to build her own nice family house.

She will share this loan with her loan group Khanga which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Salin's Group

texts.en:
Salin, a local villager from the Sangke district of Battambang Province, is 22 years old and a mother of a small baby. To provide a daily sustenance for her family, she grows paddy rice. For extra income, her husband drives a tri-motorcycle, called "Tuk Tuk" in the cambodian language, for a fee. She has been in this business for only two years, earning about 39,000 KHR per day and saving about 5,000 KHR per day. 

Salin, who had never been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before, has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. Both of them are in their first-cycle loan and are seeking the same loan amount of 300,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes to increase her output and her income, so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Oeut's Group

texts.en:
Oeut, with the rest of her family consisting of ten children, lives in Ek Phnom district of Battambang Province. Some of her children are still in school and some are helping the family's business as well as doing household chores. 

To feed her ten kids with decent daily food, she and her husband grow rice, beans, and corn; they also raise cows for extra income. Over several years in this business, she has been able to save only 4,300 KHR per day. 

In the group of two, Oeut is the leader. She and her co-borrower have been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for at least three past loan cycles. She has managed her business at a good pace by using the loans and it has returned a decent income to support her big family. Now, she and her fellow group member are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. 

Oeut is going to use her portion to buy potash, insecticide, and to pay plowing fees. With part of her loan, she is also going to buy a fishing net in order to catch fish for resale for extra income. She hopes that she can earn more income from her current business so that she can upgrade her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy potash, insecticide, and to pay plowing expenses

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
A 55-year-old mother of four children, Mao is local farmer who grows corn and rice in the rural area of Ek Phnom district of the Battambang Province. Her husband also helps, by raising cows and catching fish to sell. She has been involved in this business for 30 years and is able to earn about 34,000 KHR per day and save about 8,400 KHR each day. 

Mao's group consists of two members and both are in the second-cycle with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Her past loan helped her to improve her living conditions. 

Now, she leads her group to request a new loan. The total loan amount requested by her group is 1,150,000 KHR. With her loan portion, she is going to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to double her yield and sell with a high price, so she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Savorn, a mother of six children, is 37 years old. She and the rest of her family live in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province. To tackle the family's hardship, she and her husband work as paid workers and use their spare time to earn extra income by catching fish to sell. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business, which she has been with for 5 years. 

Including this cycle, she has been with VisionFund for four times and has completely and successfully paid back her past three cycle loans, which helped her provide her family with sufficient food. 

With the positive outcome, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She and the other member are applying for 300,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy wooden boards to fix her house. She hopes that this purchase will help her to amend her house into a proper condition on time, so she can own a decent shelter, fit for her children to live in.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards to fix her house.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en: Yat, age 45 and a rural farmer from the Srey Snom District of the Siem Reap Province, is one of the wage earners in her household consisting of six children. Currently, she needs to cater to only four children who are still in school. She is able to earn a daily income for her children's sake from the three hectares of her rice farming business. She has been farming for 10 years, but she is able to earn only 5,000 KHR per day. Yat is new to VisionFund and now she is seeking a first-loan cycle. She is requesting 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farm. She hopes to gain more crop production so that she can make more profit and keep her four children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farm

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Nav's Group

texts.en: Nav is a 47-year-old mother of six children residing in Siem Reap Province's Srey Snom District. Currently, only five of her children still depend on her as they are students in the local public school. Her main buisiness is rice cropping, which she has been engaged in for 10 years. It has netted her about 10,000 KHR per day. Nav has been with VisionFund for the four past loan cycles and has successfully repaid the loan. In a wise manner, she has used her previous loan to upgrade her standard of living. Now, she has formed a group of two to seek a new loan. Nav, as the leader, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee. She believes that she can increase her rice yield, so that she can increase her income to cover her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en:
A local villager from the Battambang province (Cambodia), Chheang is 35 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. To support her daily cost of living, she and her husband cultivate rice. The couple is able to earn up to 20,800 KHR per day.

This is the fourth loan for Chheang with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has successfully managed to pay back the past loan and it has helped her to improve her living conditions. 

Now, she is in a group of three to seek a new loan. All of them are requesting the same loan amount, of 1,000,000 KHR each. Chheang is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for labour costs. She hopes that she can increase her yield more than last year and earn more income for her children's sake.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Ream's Group

texts.en:
Married and a mother of three schoolchildren, Ream is a villager from Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She has struggled in overcoming the family's financial hardship through working as a paid worker and raising pigs. Her husband also helps her with this business, and additionally he also uses his free time to catch fish to sell, for extra income. The current business, which she has been with for 15 years, earns her about 25,200 KHR per day. 

Ream is now in a group of three, all of which are fifth-time borrowers. Ream is the group leader. She has used her past loan, which she has paid back completely, smartly in order to maintain her business and her living condition. Now, she is applying for 800,000 KHR while other two members in her group are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each. 

Ream will use her portion of the loan to purchase two more pigs to raise, pig feed and more fishing material for her husband. She hopes to fatten her pigs in a healthy condition so she can sell them for a high price. By doing so, she can earn a larger income and keep all of her children in school.

loans.use: to buy two pigs, pig feed and fishing material

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural village in the Srey Snom District of the Siem Reap Province, Sophal is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For her children's sake and especially for their education, she grows rice as the only source of her family's income. For the five years that she has engaged in this business, she has been able to earn up to 10,000 KHR per day. In a group of three, she is the leader and the third-time borrower from VisionFund (Kiva's partner). In a wise manner, she has managed to pay back the past loans, which have improved her family's living condition. For this new loan cycle, she is seeking 1,300,000 KHR, and the other two co-borrowers are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her loan's portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice farm. She believes that she will gain more crop output so that she can make a decent income to sustain her family. Now, she and the other two co-borrowers are seeking a new loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice farm

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Reap's Group

texts.en: Reap, 33 years old, lives in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey District located in Banteay Meanchey Province in Cambodia. She is married and blessed with two dependent sons, one of whom is a student while the other one is too young to attend school. To earn income for the family, Reap has been working as a rice farmer for ten years, earning around 20,000 KHR and has been managing to save approximately 6,000 KHR after offsetting her daily expenses. This will be Reap’s third time requesting a loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans made Reap so satisfied because with those loans she was able to make her family’s living condition so much better. Now she is leading a loan group of two female members to take out a new loan with VisionFund. The group representative, Reap, plans on using her new requested loan portion to purchase fertilizer to help keep her rice field in good shape. Reap highly hopes that after receiving her loan portion and using it as she plans, her current business will improve gradually as will the living standards of her family. One extra thing that makes Reap so excited is that she will be able to use the income generated by her business to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
A villager residing in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district in Cambodia, Ny is 49 years old and married. She has seven children, one of whom (a daughter) is under her responsibility and currently in school. To offer her family a decent life, Ny has been involved in the rice-growing business for more than 25 years, earning around 24,000 KHR and saving around 14,000 KHR after daily expenses. 

Ny needs funds to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. For this, she is leading a loan group of two female members, both of whom have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles already, to take out a loan in the amount of 1,700,000 KHR in total. 

Ny commented that with the help of previous loans she has succeeded in making her family’s livelihood so much better. Now, Ny is willing to use her new requested loan portion even more efficiently than the previous loans, in order to boost her income and to keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kantata Group

texts.en:
The Kantata group meets every Wednesday at Teshie in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. 

The group is comprised of three women who, three years ago, decided to come together to join ID-Ghana (MFI). This has served them very well as they have been able to grow their small businesses. They sell plastic products, plantains, kids clothes and provisions.

Mary (standing from left in the photograph) is a 41-year-old married woman with three children. She sells plastic products. She has nine years of experience and works from Monday to Saturday from morning to evening. She is constantly working to improve her business. This is her fifth loan with ID-Ghana and she needs 900 Ghana cedis to buy plastic chairs, plastic bowls, plantains and pampers to sell to customers.

She sells these products to generate money to take care of family expenses and for her housing project. She has been doing this business for six years and the business is going well. She buys from the market and sells in her locality. 

The group members need a total of 2,200 Ghana cedis to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy plastic products, such as plastic chairs and bowls, to sell to customers

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria tiene vive en el suburbio de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Es casada tiene 5 hijos que son mayores de edad por lo que son independientes. Ella aprendiendo de su tío quien tenía la profesión de corte y confeccion, le gusto mucho por lo que realizo varios cursos para ampliar sus conocimientos y mejorar las técnicas. En la actualidad  Gloria tiene su taller donde Trabaja con unas ayudantes  de lunes a viernes  desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Su especialidad son los ternos de caballeros los cuales tienen gran acogida, también confecciona camisas, pantalones unisex, blusas y uniformes, y vestidos. El taller está ubicado en su domicilio donde tiene sus máquinas  y una mesa para el corte. El mayor problema que enfrenta Gloria  es la entrega de las prendas una vez terminadas, como se mueve en busetas teme que los ladrones roben su trabajo. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, agujas etc. Su meta es ampliar más su negocio para así poder dar ofrecer trabajo a muchas gentes que tenga.
texts.en: Gloria lives in El Suburbio in the city of Guayaquil.  She’s married and has five adult children who live independently.  She learned from her uncle who also worked in dressmaking and design.  She liked it very much so she took several courses to expand her skills and improve her technique.  Gloria currently has her workshop where she hires some assistants to work Monday through Friday from 7am until 5pm.  Her specialty is men’s three-piece suits which are in high demand and she also makes shirts, unisex pants, blouses, uniforms and dresses.  Her workshop is located at home which is where she has her machines and a cutting table.  Gloria’s greatest problem is delivering the finished products because since she must travel in public minibuses she fears that thieves will rob her.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy fabric, thread, buttons, needles, etc.  Her goal is to expand the business so she can offer employment to people.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thrad, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Leoncio Manuel

texts.es: Leoncio tiene 50 años de edad es casado  tiene hijos que son mayores de edad por lo que son independientes. Comenzó hace ya 25 años atrás ingresando en un curso para aprender el oficio de reparaciones de aparatos electrónicos. Fue entonces que lo motivo a dar la apertura de su taller de reparaciones de aparatos eléctricos y además vende repuestos de televisores, DVD, radios. El trabaja solo de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Con el crédito quiere comprar herramientas, repuestos etc. Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio para que así sus clientes se sientan satisfechos
texts.en:
Leoncio is 50 years old.  He is married and has children that are of legal age so they are independent.
