Twenty-five years ago, he began by enrolling in a course to learn the trade of repairing electrical appliances.  This was what motivated him to open his electrical appliances repair shop and to also sell spare parts for televisions, DVDs, and radios.  He only works Monday through Saturday from 9 in the morning until 5 in the evening. 

With the loan, he wants to buy tools, spare parts, etc.  His dream is to expand his business so that his customers are satisfied.

loans.use: to buy tools, spare parts, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Creativas Group

texts.es: Mujeres Creativas, son un grupo solidario compuesto por 5 mujeres y llamado así por innovadoras y creadoras. Norma es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es una mujer de 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 3 años, todos son estudiantes. norma se dedica a la venta de artículos varios en mercados rodantes como: cosméticos, juguetes, novedades, etc. desde hace aproximadamente 10 años. El crédito la ha ayudado mucho y ahora va a comprar un gran pedido de bolsos para mujer que tiene pendiente.Su esposo la ayuda a vender los sábados y domingos que son los días que él descansa. Menciona que piensa seguir con la venta en mercados y desea seguir creciendo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos en el hogar, además de apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women) is a solidarity group made up of 5 women. Their group name came about because they are innovative and creative. 

Norma is one of the members of this group. She is 32 years old, is married, and has 3 children aged 16, 13 and 3. They are all in school. For approximately 10 years, Norma has sold a variety of items at street markets such as: cosmetics, toys, novelty items, etc. 

The loan has helped her a lot and now she is going to pay for a big order of handbags that she has outstanding. Her husband helps her sell on Saturdays and Sundays which are his days off. She says that she is thinking of continuing to sell in markets and hopes to continue growing in order to help her husband with the household costs as well as supporting her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy women's handbags.

loans.name: Eclipse Group

texts.es: Eclipse es un grupo solidario, compuesto por 5 mujeres que luchan por cumplir sus sueños a través de su gran esfuerzo. María Concepción es una mujer responsable y trabajadora de 53 años, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la pavimentación y tiene 2 hijos de 35 y 38 años, ambos son casados.Concepción se dedica a la venta de malteadas nutritivas y productos para el cuidado de la salud, desde hace 6 años. Decidió comenzar con este negocio por una enfermedad, ella comenzó a tomar estos productos y logro mejorar su salud y bajar de peso, después le ofrecieron que vendiera estos productos, así como también la renta de un local y todo lo que ocuparía y dichosa acepto. Ha luchado mucho por salir adelante y tal vez la ganancia sea poca, pero para ella es mas la satisfacción que tiene al ver a tanta gente que gracias a ella, a sus servicios y a sus productos puede mejorar su salud. El crédito lo utilizara para comprar mas producto para las malteadas y sillas, ya que tiene muy pocas. Un sueño que quiere cumplir es tener su propio local, para no tener que pagar renta. Eclipse es un grupo bueno y el único día que se ven tratan de llevarse bien, son muy buenas amigas y quieren ser el mejor grupo.
texts.en: “Eclipse” is a communal bank consisting of five women who strive to reach their dreams by means of their great effort.  The members chose this name because their weekly meetings take place in a snack bar of the same name.  María Concepción, 53, is a responsible, hardworking, married woman; her husband works as a paver; they have two children who are 35 and 38 years of age, both married.  Concepción has been working selling nutritional malts made from ingredients that are designed to promote health for the last six years.  She decided to start this business because of an illness.  She started taking these products and succeeded in improving her health and in losing weight and they offered her the opportunity to sell these products as well as to pay the rent for the locale and everything else needed to set up and she happily accepted.  She’s struggled mightily to get ahead and profits are perhaps few but for her the satisfaction is seeing so many people who thanks to her, her services and her products, are able to improve their health.  She will use the loan to buy more ingredients for the malts and to buy chairs because she only has a few.  A dream she wants to reach is to have her own locale in order to save on rent.  Eclipse is a good group and the one day they see each other they try to get along well; they are good friends and want to be the best group.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the malts and to buy chairs.

loans.name: María Estefania

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la Provincia de Manabi se reúne el Banco Comunal Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 3 y 2 años. El marido es agricultor. 

Ella es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios ingresos, para esto se dedica a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta  y trabaja tres días a la semana sobre todo en las mañanas, aunque la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva más de 2 años con su negocio en el cual le va muy bien. Su mercadería se la trae su esposo desde Quito ya que el viaja a esta ciudad con frecuencia.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar pantalones, blusas y ropa de niños. Lleva tres ciclos en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo Canton is located in Manabí Province.  The “Caña Brava de 24 de Mayo” communal bank meets here.  This place is known for its beautiful scenery and hardworking people who work in agriculture and animal husbandry.  María, 20, lives here.  She’s in a free union and has two children who are 3 and 2 years.  Her husband is a farmer.

She is a very hardworking young woman who likes to fend for herself and earn her own income which is why she works selling all types of clothes door to door.  She works three days a week especially in the morning although most of her sales take place at home where she has some display cases.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She’s been in business more than two years and does very well.  She brings her merchandise from Quito because she travels there frequently.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because the loans are very helpful for her business.  Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and children's clothes.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora María De Lourdes, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad,  la menor aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en  una  comisión de transito.

Doña María D e Lourdes es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios ingresos para ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica  a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo, sandalias y perfumes, vende en su casa lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando le llega mercadería nueva misma que recibe desde los Estados Unidos ya que una hermana se la envía una vez al mes, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva más de 10 años con su negocio y tiene buena clientela. Ella también tiene un complejo turístico en el cantón donde vive.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar ropa, perfumes y sandalias. Lleva cuatro ciclos  en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho. 

Su sueño es ampliar más su negocio y su complejo turístico.
texts.en:
The Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo Communal Bank meets in 24 de Mayo Canton, in the province of Manabí.  This canton is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hardworking people who are engaged in farming and raising animals.

María De Lourdes, 51 years old, lives here.  She is married and has three adult children; the youngest still lives with her.  Her husband works for the transit commission.  

María De Lourdes is a woman who likes to stand on her own two feet and earn her own income to help pay the household expenses.  She sells all types of clothing, sandals, and perfumes.  Once a month, her sister sends her new merchandise from the United States and customers come to her home to make purchases. She extends credit and collects payments weekly.   She has been in business over ten years and has a good clientele.  She also owns a tourist resort in the canton where she lives.

She will use this loan to purchase clothing, perfumes, and sandals.  This is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes the loans because they are quick and very helpful.  Her dream is to expand her business and her tourist resort

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfume, and sandals.

loans.name: Walter Oswaldo

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la Provincia de Manabi se reúne el Banco Comunal Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive el señor Walter, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Don Walter para obtener sus ingresos decidió construir un pequeño galpón, en el cual puso unos pocos pollos pero con el paso de los días y con la ayuda de los créditos aumento su producción y en la actualidad tiene  200 pollos, los mismo que mantiene por dos a tres meses y luego de este tiempo los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pollos medicinas y alimentos para los pollos ya que la época venidera es muy buena y necesitan de capital para invertir. Lleva cuatro ciclos  en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.
 
Sus sueños son seguir aumentado su granja y vender más pollos.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo Canton is located in Manabí Province.  The “Caña Brava de 24 de Mayo” communal bank meets there.  This place is known for its beautiful scenery and hardworking people who work in agriculture and animal husbandry.  Walter, 29, lives here.  He’s in a free union and has two children who are 7 and 2 years of age; the oldest attends school.  His wife’s a housewife.

To earn income, Walter decided to build a small shed where he installed a few chicks but with the passage of time and help from the loans his production increased and he now has 200 chicks that he keeps for two to three months and then sells them to merchants who come by his house.

This loan is to buy chicks, medicine and feed for them because the upcoming season is very good and they need capital to invest.  He’s been in the communal bank for four cycles and likes it because the loans are very helpful.  His dream is to continue enlarging his farm and to sell more chickens.

loans.use: to buy chicks, medicine and chicken feed.

loans.name: Zoila Lucia

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Zoila para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a solventar los gastos que genera mantener el hogar y viendo que su esposo no gana mucho, decidió dedicarse a la cría de pollos y chanchos, hace 8 años su esposo construyo un galpón en el cual mete más de 200 pollos los mismo que mantiene de dos a tres meses y luego de este tiempo los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, medicinas, alimentos para pollos y para pagar la mano de obra de los ayudantes de su marido que están desherbando el terreno para comenzar con los sembríos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado los créditos. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the Manabí province, we find the 24 de Mayo canton. In this canton, the “Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo” communal bank reunites. This place is known for beautiful scenery and for the hardworking people dedicated to farming and raising animals. 

Zoila lives here. She is 58 years old, married and she has four children who are all older and independent. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Zoila raises chickens and pigs for eight years. She has done this in order to earn her own income and help pay the expenses that come from the household since her husband doesn’t earn a lot. Her husband constructed a shed that holds more than 200 chickens. They are kept for two the three months and they are given to traders who come to her house. 

This loan is for purchasing chickens, medications and chicken feed. It is also for paying the laborers helping her husband who is weeding the plot in order to start sewing the fields. She has been in the communal bank from the beginning. She likes the help that the loans always give. 

Her dreams are to move forward and to have better health.

loans.use: purchase chickens, medications, chicken feed and pay laborers.

loans.name: Zoila Monserrate

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos 14, 12 y 6 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un almacén.

Doña Zoila  se dedica a la cría de aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos que en temporadas compra de cien a doscientos pollos, los cuales los cría de dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, cuando ya están listos los pollos los pela y los entrega en algunas tiendas de su ciudad y también vende por libras por su casa. Trabaja de tres a cuatro horas al día en la alimentación y cuidado de sus animalitos y casi todo el día cuando tiene que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar la mayor cantidad de pollos que pueda ya que viene la época de Navidad y esta temporada es muy buena y es cuando más ganancias deja el negocio. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho. 

Sus sueños son poner una tienda y seguir adelante para darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The 24 de mayo canton is situated in Manabí province and it is here that the 24 de mayo Caña Brava communal bank meets.  It is a area noted for its beautiful scenery and for its hardworking inhabitants who work in farming and animal breeding.  One of these is Zoila.  She is 35 years old, is married and has three children of 14, 12 and 6 years of age.  The two older children are at secondary school and the youngest goes to primary school.  Zoila's husband works in a warehouse.  

Zoila is a poultry breeder and has a small chicken farm.  During the breeding season she buys between a hundred and two hundred chickens and rears them for the two to three months it takes for them to be ready to be sold.  She then skins them and delivers them to a number of shops in her town, whilst also selling some by the pound from home.  She works three to four hours a day feeding and caring for her animals and almost all day when she has to make deliveries.  

She will use this new loan to buy as many chickens as she can, now that Christmas is approaching.  For her, this is a very good period of the year when her business is most profitable.  She has been a member of the bank since it began and is very happy with the help she has received from it.  Her dreams are to set up a shop, be successful and do the best she can for her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anna Karina

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas 16 y 12 años de edad, ambas  estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en un Ministerio.

Ella trabaja de maestra en una escuela de loa localidad pero también se dedica a la cría de animales en su casa, para lo cual construyo un galpón y empezó con la cría de pollos, pero con el paso del tiempo también construyó otro para criar chanchos, ella los alimenta y cuando ya tienen un peso adecuado los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar la mayor cantidad de pollos que pueda ya que viene la época de Navidad y en esta época es cuando más vende. Lleva tres ciclos  en el Banco, es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy ordenadas. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabí is the 24 De Mayo canton. There the Caña Brava de 24 De Mayo communal bank meets. The place is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hardworking people who farm and raise animals.
 
This is where Ana lives. She is 39 years old, married and has two daughters, aged 16 and 12. Both of them are in school. Her husband works in a government office.

She is a teacher at a local school but she also raises animals at home. She built a shed and started by raising chickens. Over time she also built a shed to raise pigs. She feeds them and when they weigh enough she sells them to merchants who go to her house.

She is going to use this loan to buy the largest quantity of chickens she can since Chirstmas is coming and that is when she sells the most. She has been in the bank for three cycles. She is the group's secretary and she likes it because the other members are very organized.

Her dream is to give the best to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Aurora Georgina

texts.es:
En la playa de San Clemente del Cantón Sucre cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Bankito Del Norte. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Aurora, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun  vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Doña Aurora para poder ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un pequeña carnicería en su casa en la cual desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo, carne de res por libras y mariscos de toda clase, en su local también tiene un congelador de helados pingüinos con lo cual se gana algo extra especialmente los fines de semana que es cuando más turistas acuden al lugar. Trabaja todos los días desde la madrugada que acude a la playa a surtirse de mariscos o al mercado de mayoristas  a comprar la carne y los pollos. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pollos carne de res y mariscos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un local más amplio y surtido.
texts.en:
On the beach of San Clemente in the region of Sucre every fifteen days the communal bank "Bankito del Norte" (Little bank of the North) meets. This place is known for its beautiful beaches and are visited by many national and international tourists and offers a variety of different beautiful places and a rich variety of regional dishes. 

It is here that Mrs. Aurora lives, she is 59 years old, married and has seven children from this relationship, they are all adults now but two still live with her. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Mrs. Aurora, to earn something on her own, runs her own business. She has a small butcher shop she runs from home and she has worked in this capacity for three years, selling chicken, beef by the pound and all kinds of seafood. At her site, she has a refrigerator full of ice cream from which she earns a little extra, especially on the weekends when the tourists come. She works every day from the early morning and goes to the beach to pick up seafood or to the market to purchase meat or chickens.  

This loan will help her to purchase more chickens, beef and seafood. She has been with the communal bank since it was formed and she likes being a member because of the help and benefits she receives. 

Her dream is to have her own bigger and well stocked store.

loans.use: purchase chickens, beef and seafood.

loans.name: Mariana Moserrate

texts.es:
En la playa de San Clemente del Cantón Sucre cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Bankito Del Norte. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son  visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante y guardia de seguridad.
 
Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas  diarias, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the beach of  San Clemente in the Sucre canton, the Bankito Del Norte communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and foreign tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of regional traditional dishes.

This is where Mariana lives. She is 27 years old and in a common law marriage from which she has two children, aged 11 and 7. They are in school. Her husband is a merchant and a security guard. 
 
She is a houswife who in order to help he rhusband with the household expenses sells clothing via catalog and Yanbal products (beauyt products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accesories). She works three days a week for rwo to three hours. She sells on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this for more than 2 years and it is going well for her. What she sells the most is perfume.

This loaan is to buy perfumes, creams and clothing. She has been in her communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the payments are easy to do. 

Her dream is to have a store.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Keochenda

texts.en:
Keochenda, age 23 and a mother of one young daughter, lives in Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She raises her family by selling vegetables and raising chickens. To earn additional income, her husband drives a motor-taxi for a fee to better support the entire household. Keochenda has been involved in these businesses for 3 years and they enable her to earn up to 18,500 KHR per day. 

Keochenda's prior loan was her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past loan, which she has completely paid back, has supported her family with decent food better than before. Since she is short of working capital to support her business, Keochenda is applying for a second-cycle loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR. For her, some of this loan portion will be used to fix her house, while most of it will be used to purchase more vegetables for resale. She highly hopes that she can double her income from her current business and improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Lat

texts.en:
Lat, originally from Kror Kor district of Cambodia, is 45 years old and a widowed mother of two schoolchildren and two paid workers. For her children's sake as a single mother who raises her children alone, Lat sells sweets and beverages in the community. She is able to earn up to 19,700 KHR per day from the current business that she has engaged in for three years. 

This is the first time that Lat has applied for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. She is going to use her portion to purchase additional items for resale, including cookies, fruit juice and grocery items, etc.. She hopes that she can replenish her selling items on time, so she can triple her income and improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy cookies, fruit juice and grocery items for resale

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village located in Pursat province's Kror Kor district, Sokhorn is a widow and has four children. Her main income is from 1.5 hectares of rice growing and a business raising pigs, from which she is able to earn up to 17,900 KHR per day; it is the business that she has been with for 32 years. 

Sokhorn is new to VisionFund (Kiva's partner). In this first-cycle loan, she is applying for 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy two cows to support her farm. She expects to make more income from both her businesses, so she can uplift her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy two cows to support her farm

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Age 46 and a local viilager from Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Song is married and blessed with 11 children. To encounter the family's difficulty, she grows paddy (rice) and raises one pig. Her husband catches fish for resale. The business, which she has had for years, earns her a daily income of about 9,500 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Song with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is applying for 800,000 KHR in order to buy more pigs and pig feed to support her pig-raising business. With part of her loan portion, she is going to buy fishing materials for her husband to catch more fish. She hopes to increase her income and relieve her family's burden.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and pig feed to support her pig-raising business

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea, age 31 and married, is a mother of four children who are still in school. To deal with daily cost of living, she has been raising pigs for 15 years and is able to earn up to 11,500 KHR per day. Her husband is a doctor in the rural community. 

In a group of two, Kunthea is in the first loan while her co-borrower is in the third loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The entire group loan is 1,800,000 KHR. For Kunthea, her loan portion in amount of 800,000 KHR will be used to buy pig's feed for her only business and medicine for her husband's occupation. She expects to fatten her pigs in a healthy condition so she can sell at a high price with high income. Hence, she can keep up a good pace of her living condition.

loans.use: To buy pig's feed

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en: Thoeurn is 32 years old and a local farmer from Pursat Province's Kror Kor district in Cambodia. He makes a living through rice crops, which he has been doing for 4 years, and his wife also generates additional income through running a fee based boat facility. He is able to earn up to 8,900 KHR per day.  All of his income is used mainly to cover the daily food expenses for his three children as two of them are still in school and a remaining kid is a young little one.  Thoeurn has been with VisionFund for a two-cycle loan and has completely paid back the loan. His past loan has helped him better support his business and gradually upgrade his living conditions.  Now, in a group of two, he is the leader.  For his part of the loan, he is going to purchase fertilizer for his rice farm. He strongly believes that he can generate higher production and keep improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Chamroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Chamroeurn is married and has one child in school. She and her family live in a rural village in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She covers their cost of living with her 1.5-hectare rice field, and her husband supplements the family income by producing concrete pipes to sell. With her five years' experience in this business, she is able to save up to 17,000 KHR per day, after offsetting expenses from her income of 57,000 KHR. 

This loan will be Chamroeurn's second with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has successfully paid back her first loan in full, and it helped her to have sufficient working capital to purchase fertilizer to boost her crop productivity. Chamroeurn now is the leader of a microloan group consisting of four members. She and one of her co-borrowers are each seeking 1,000,000 KHR while the other two members are requesting 1,400,000 KHR each. Chamroeurn will use her entire portion to support her husband's business by purchasing sand, cement, and gravel for making concrete pipes. She hopes this purchase will help her husband to make a lot of tanks for resale in a timely fashion. Any additional profit will enable them to keep their only daughter in school.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement, and gravel for making concrete pipes

loans.name: Chamnan

texts.en: Chamnan, aged 29, resides in Battambang province and is the mother of one son. She has overcome her daily hardships through rice farming and working as a teacher in a local public school. Her husband uses his free time to earn additional income by raising fish. Chamnan has joined VisionFund twice, including this cycle. After successfully repaying her previous loan in full, she feels confident that she can continue to improve her living conditions. She is applying for a new loan in amount of 500 U.S. dollars. She will use this loan to buy rice seed and gasoline for pumping water for her rice field. She greatly hopes that she can upgrade her living conditions with the larger income she expects to receive from her current business.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and gasoline for pumping water

loans.name: Saluon

texts.en:
Saluon is 44 years old and married. She has six children, three of whom are students; the rest of her family lives in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is a farmer who grows beans, corn, and watermelons in order to support her family. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her husband also helps to earn more income by catching fish to sell. 

Saluon has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for eight loan cycles, including this cycle. She has repaid her previous loans successfully, using them to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Currently, she is able to earn up to 253,600 KHR per day and save almost 39,000 KHR per day after deducting expenses. For this cycle, she is applying for 3,500,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for plowing. In addition, a portion of the loan will be used to purchase fish for resale. She has high hopes that she can make more income from her both businesses so she can keep her children in school to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en: Nan, age 38, is the mother of four children who are studying in the local public school located in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang Province. To provide daily sustenance for her children, she sells dessert in the school and raises cows while her husband raises rice on five hectares of farmland. For 10 years she has been able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day. Nan is the leader of a group of three who are fourth-time borrowers. Her past loans provided sufficient working capital for her rice-growing business and returned a decent profit to cover her daily expenses and her children's education. Now, she and a co-member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each while their third member is applying for 500,000 KHR. Nan is going to use her portion of the loan to buy potash and insecticide and to pay for plowing and labor costs. She hopes to have a high yield in order to have more income to continue supporting her household as well as to pay for her children' studies.

loans.use: To buy potash and insecticide and to pay for plowing and labor

loans.name: Marum

texts.en: A rural villager from Kampong Cham province's Dambae district, Marum is 39 years old and has three children who are still in school. She and her husband work as blacksmiths in order to tackle their daily cost of living. They have been in this business for two years, and it currently earns them about 55,900 KHR per day, of which they are able to save approximately 15,000 KHR each day. This is Marum's second loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She used her past loan wisely to relieve her family's burdens and improve their livelihood, and she has paid back the entire loan. Her new loan request is for 4,000,000 KHR. She will use the funds to buy necessary materials for her welding business. She hopes that this purchase will help her to support her business and make more income in order to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to support her husband's blacksmith business

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Chhin is 52 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is still in school while her remaining three children are employed. She lives in a wooden house covered by zinc in the Sa Ang district of Kandal Provice, Cambodia. Chhin's main source of income is her four-hectare rice farm. After helping on the rice farm, her husband catches fish to sell for extra income. Chhin has had her current business for 32 years, and she is able to save up to 5 US dollars per day after expenses. Chhin has just joined VisionFund (Kiva's partner) this loan cycle. She is seeking a loan of 750 US dollars in order to buy a small boat and a machine for her husband's fishing business. She hopes that her husband can catch more fishes and sell them at a high price so that she can upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a small boat and a machine

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla, a local farmer from Takeo Province’s Bati district, Cambodia, is 32 years old and the married father of three schoolchildren. He grows rice and his wife sells sugarcane juice in order to support their children. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. Phalla is applying for his second loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. He used his previous loan to expand his business gradually and to support his family. He has completely repaid his first loan already. His new loan request is for 500 US dollars. He will use the loan to buy a sugarcane squeezing machine to support his wife's business and fertilizer for his farmland. He expects to receive a high yield so he can earn more income in order to maintain his children's education.

loans.use: To buy a sugarcane squeezing machine and fertilizer

loans.name: Mony's Group

texts.en: Mony is the mother of two young kids. She lives in Kandal province's Kandal Stoeung district, Cambodia. She is 29 years old and runs a small shop for tailoring clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her husband is a driver. Mony is a fourth-cycle loan client, who has just joined VisionFund (Kiva's partner) with her co-member. The leader of her borrower group, she completely paid back her past loans successfully, and they have helped her to provide decent, sufficient food for her children. Now, she and her group member are each seeking loans in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR. Mony is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pigs to raise for additional income. She hopes to fatten her pigs to a large size and sell them for a good price so she can multiply her income for her children's sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Chaniy

texts.en: ChanIy is 25 years old and married. She has one young kid to care for. To make a living, she grows rice and her husband drives a motor-taxi. Additionally, both of them also raise pigs at home. She has 6 years' experience in this business, and she is able to earn up to 24,400 KHR per day. This is the second loan for ChanIy with Kiva's partner VisionFund. Her past loan provided her enough capital to start up her new business, pig-raising. It also relieved her family's financial burden. Now she is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pig feed. She hopes to raise her pigs into a healthy condition and make more income so that she can set aside some money to send her child to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Heam's Group

texts.en: Heam lives in a thatched-roof house located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. He is 51 years old and the father of two schoolchildren and two paid workers. Together with his wife, he has been growing rice on two hectares of farmland in order to meet the basic needs of the family, especially their children. He is able to earn up to 24,700 KHR per day. Heam has never borrowed through VisionFund before. All of the members in his four-person group are first-time borrowers. Heam is seeking a loan of 800,000 KHR while his other three group members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. The leader of his borrower group, Heam will use his portion of the loan to buy four sacks of fertilizer and pigs to raise for additional income. He hopes to make more income from his current business so that he can save some money to run a small bicycle-repair shop for extra income.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of fertilizer and pigs

loans.name: Huch's Group

texts.en: An original citizen from the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, Huch is 44 years old and married. She has four children, only one of whom still needs her support as her daughter is still in school. Her main business is rice-cropping on five hectares of farmland. Involved in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 10,000 KHR per day. Huch has been with VisionFund for five cycle loans ago and has completely paid back her past loan. It has supported her business gradually and improves her lifestyle. Now, she has formed a group of six to apply for a new loan. Her other four members are in the fourth-cycle loan and a remaining one has just joined VisionFund this cycle. The entire group requesting loan is 5,250,000 KHR. For Huch's portion, which is in amount of 1,400,000 KHR, she is going to purchase fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to double her crop yield and make more income so she can maintain her living conditions and keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Soeur's Group

texts.en: Soeur, age 40, is a resident from the Siem Reap Province's Srey Snom District. Her family consists of seven members, including her five children who are still in school. For this big household, she has struggled with her husband in cultivating rice on two hectares of farmland. She has been involved in this business for 10 years, and it earns her about 10,000 KHR per day. There are three members in the same group, and all of them are first-cycle borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She and one of her co-borrowers are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each whereas the remaining borrower is applying for 300,000 KHR. For Soeur's loan portion, she is going to buy fertilizer and insecticide. She hopes this purchase will minimize the loss of her crop yield due to pests and will provide her with a good yield and a high profit so that she can keep all of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Vun's Group

texts.en: A young mother of five schoolchildren, Von, is 27 years old and married. She has managed her two hectares of farmland for rice cropping. It is the only business that she has been engaged in for 5 years, and she is able to earn about 5,000 KHR per day. Von is in a group consisting of three members, and they are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The total amount of her entire group's requested loan is 1,800,000 KHR. Von, the leader, is going to use her portion (1,000,000 KHR) to build a decent house for her family, especially for her children. Moreover, she will use a portion of it to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to own a proper house for her children and to receive a high crop yield so that she can increase her income and keep all of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Et's Group

texts.en: A resident of a rural area of the Kror Kor district in the Pursat province of Cambodia, Et is a 33-year-old married woman with two daughters and two sons, all of whom are under her responsibility. Three of her children are currently in school while the other one is too young to attend school. To provide a decent life for her family, Et has been farming rice and raising pigs tirelessly, earning around 18,000KHR per day and saving approximately 8,000KHR after offsetting her daily cost of living. Et, a second-cycle client with VisionFund, is leading a group member who is just a first-cycle client with VisionFund to take out a loan in the amount of 400,000KHR and 100,000KHR respectively. Et comments that the previous loan that she obtained and successfully paid back has enabled her to meet her family's needs and buy some household supplies. Now with this new requested loan portion, Et plans on purchasing pig feeds. Through the use of this loan, she expects that her pigs will be fatter and healthier so that she can sell them at a good price, generating more income for the family. She will use that income to advance her children's education further.

loans.use: To purchase pig feeds

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
Moses, who is in his early 30s, is single with one child. He has been running a second hand clothes business since 2009. He works from 8am to 7pm daily and he is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

He is requesting his for a first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to increase more on stock of clothes to resell. His dream is to one day be able to expand his business in more places.

Moses will share this loan with his loan group "Malumbo" which totals 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase more on  stock of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his mid 30s, is married and living together with his wife and with seven children, four of whom are in school and the remaining already completed school. He has been running genge business selling fruits and vegetable for three years now. He works from 8am to 7pm daily and he is able to earn a fair monthly profit.

He request for the first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants this loan to increase on the genge stock items and start selling charcoal in his genge business. His dream is to one day be able to expand his business to more places.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Sisi Kwa Sisi" which totals 10 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the genge stock items and start selling charcoal in his genge business.

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en: Rem is a villager who resides in Pursat province's Kror Kor district in Cambodia. She is 31 years old and married with three dependent sons, all of whom are too young to attend school. Rem supports her family by farming rice and selling grocery items. She has eight years of experience in her current businesses, earning around 17,000 KHR per day and managing to save approximately 7,000 KHR after deducting her daily expenses. Rem is now in need of money to support her rice field. Thus, she is leading a loan group of two female members, who both have been with VisionFund for a loan cycle already, to apply for a loan in the amount of 450,000 KHR in total. The past loan that Rem successfully paid back has allowed her to make the family's lifestyle so much better, which makes her so satisfied. Now with her new requested loan portion in this loan, which is 300,000 KHR, Rem will utilize it even more efficiently than the previous one. She will purchase fertilizer to help keep her rice field in good shape. Rem has high hopes that she can boost her income with the help of her loan portion and use the income generated by the rice-growing business, to send her beloved sons to school in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es: El joven rolando tiene la edad de 21 años, vive en el barrio Villa Venezuela con sus padres,  es soltero sin hijos, hace trabajos de carpintería y tapiceria oficio que aprendió de su padre, este primer crédito lo invertirá en materiales para su negocio comprando tela para tapizar, pliegos de esponjas, pega de contacto y otros materiales y accesorios para hacer bien su trabajo, así poco a poco irá saliendo adelante y en un futuro quiere tener su taller de ebanistería más grande para así mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y obtener más clientela, con los ingresos ayudar a su familia y ahorrar para un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Young Roland is 21 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Venezuela with his parents. He is single and has no children. He does carpentry and upholstery- trades which he learnt from his father. 

He will use this first loan to invest in equipment for his business, buying upholstery fabric, sponge polishing sheets, contact glue, and other equipment and tools so he can do his job well, allowing him to move forward little by little. 

In the future he wants a bigger furniture workshop in order to improve his working conditions and attract more customers, using the proceeds to help his family and save for a better future.

loans.use: to buy upholstery fabric, sponge polishing sheets, contact glue, and other equipment and tools.

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: A 33-year-old married woman named Chanthorn resides in a rural village of Kror Kor district located in Pursat province in Cambodia. She is blessed with three lovely dependent daughters, two of whom are currently in school while the other is too young to attend school. Chanthorn and her husband earn their living by farming rice and selling grocery items, together earning around 23,000KHR per day. Chanthorn, a second-time borrower with VisonFund, is leading a group member who is just a first-time borrower with VisionFund to request a loan in the amount of 700,000KHR in total. With the previous loan, Chanthorn succeeded in increasing her crop yields as well as boosting her income. Now hoping to earn more income for the family, she will use her new requested loan portion, which is 500,000KHR, to purchase fertilizer to apply to her rice field. Chanthorn believes that she will be able to make her family's living condition even better than before and, most importantly, be able to pursue her children's schooling.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Chicas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Chicas trabajadoras son un grupo compuesto por siete mujeres y se definen como tales ya que el grupo se consideran como personas luchistas y trabajadoras. La integrante cuya historia será redactada es Ana Luisa. Es una mujer de 44 años y su estado civil es divorciada, tiene 5 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y dos menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior. Sin embargo ella empezó con la venta de comida y después la invitaron a vender ropa interior, ya lleva dos años en el negocio. Ella busca el crédito para que la ayude a empezar a  vender cobertores.
Ana Luisa cuenta que su aspiración es tener su propio negocio. Un dato interesante que nos dio del grupo es que todas son muy puntuales y responsables con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Chicas Trabajadoras [Working Women] is a group comprised of seven women and they define themselves as such because the group considers themselves determined and hardworking people.  

The member whose story will be written is Ana Luisa.  She is a 44-year-old woman and she is divorced. She has 5 children, three are of legal age and two are minors.  She sells underwear.  However, she began by selling food and was later invited to sell underwear. She has been in business for two years.  
She is looking for a loan to help her begin to sell bedspreads.  Ana Luisa says that her aspiration is to have her own business.  

An interesting piece of information that the group tells us is that they are very punctual and responsible with their payments

loans.use: to start selling bedspreads

loans.name: Nery Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora, dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Nery, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada hace y fruto de esta relación tuvo4 hijos que son mayores de edad y dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de atún en la ciudad de Manta.
 
Doña Nery para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde también vende gas de uso domestico, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00  hasta las 20h00. Además fabrica y vende bolos (helados) de distintos sabores los mismos que son muy apetecidos por sus clientes, lleva más de 12 años con su negocio el cual  le encanta ya que  siempre está en contacto con todas sus amigas que son sus clientes y así se gana algo sin salir de su casa.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir aun más su tienda y tanques de gas de uso domestico. Lleva más de tres años en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque comparte buenos momentos con sus amigas en las reuniones.
 
Sus sueños seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "María Auxiliadora" meets in the parish of Sequita, which is a part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, filled with working men and women who are dedicated and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are honest people who work hard and devote themselves to their families.

In this area, Nery, a 42 year old woman lives.  She is married and has 4 children as a result of this union, all of whom are of age, and two of whom still live with her at home.  Her husband works in a tuna processing plant in the city of Manta.

Nery, to make a bit of money, works in commerce, and she has a grocery store in her home where she also sells propane for household use.  There she sells all kinds of goods for everyday usage, and she works every day from 6:00am until 8:00pm.  In addition, she makes and sells ice cream cones of different flavors, which are very appetizing for her customers.  She has been working in this business for the past 12 years, and she loves it because it puts her in constant contact with her friends who are her customers, and so she gets something out of it without even leaving her house.

She plans to use this loan to buy more groceries to fill up her store with products and propane tanks for household use.  She has been with the communal bank for more than three years, and she likes it because of the good times that she has with her female friends at their meetings.  Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods and tanks of propane for household use.

loans.name: Mercedes Sebastiana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 5 hijos todos ya son  mayores de edad, tres  de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella como buena esposa trata de ayudar a su esposo en lo que más puede por eso realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de frutas, legumbres y verduras el mismo que lo realiza cuatro días de la semana en un mercado de Manta,  el señor se desplaza de madrugada a dicho mercado con la finalidad de comprar a comerciantes mayoristas y luego realizar sus ventas a las personas que asistan a este centro de abastos a comprar los productos para el consumo diario, lleva más de 15 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Lleva 12 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The loan group "María Auxiliadora" meets in the parish of Sequita, which is a part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, known for the famous straw hats which are appreciated inside the country and around the world.

Mercedes a 47 year old woman, lives here.  She is married and has 5 children as a result, all of whom are over the age of 18, though three of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a businessman.

She tries to help out her husband like a good wife as much as she can, and for this reason, she is asking for a loan so that he can use it in his business. He works as a fruit, legume,s and vegetable vendor which he does four days a week in the market in Manta.  Her husband goes at sunrise to the aforementioned market with the aim of buying from the wholesale vendors, and then he makes his sales to the people who come to the marketplace to buy their daily necessities.  He has spent more than 15 years in this business, which allows him to get ahead in life.

She will use her loan funds to buy fruits, vegetables, and legumes.  She has spent 12 years with her communal bank, and she likes it because of the help she has been given through her loans.

Her dream is to have a fully stocked shop.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and legumes.

loans.name: Lelia Orfelia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
Aquí vive la señora Lelia, tiene 73 años  de edad, está separada hace varios años pero de esta relación tuvieron 7 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes.

Doña Leila para poder subsistir y tener para sus gastos hace varios años puso un pequeño bar en su casa en el cual vende aguas, sodas, energizantes, hielo, cervezas, entre otras bebidas, ella aprovecha que frente a su casa se reúnen todos los días personas que hacen deporte pues allí hay canchas de futbol y voleibol, también ella prepara deliciosos helados de frutas, tiene su negocio por más de diez años y esto le ha servido para sus gastos ya que es una persona que vive sola.

Este crédito es para comprar sodas, aguas, frutas, azúcar, etc. para prepara los deliciosos helados. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella puede salir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The loan group "María Auxiliadora" gets together every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, a canton known for the famous straw hats that are appreciated by people near and far.

Lelia lives here and is 73 years old.  She has been separated from her husband for years, but in their relationship, they had 7 children, all of whom are grown up and independent now.

Leila, in order to survive and have enough for her costs of living, a few years ago put a small bar into her house where she sells water, sodas, energy drinks, ice, beer, and other drinks.  She takes advantage of the fact that every day people get together right in front of her house to play sports where there are football (soccer) and volleyball courts.  She also makes delicious fruit ices.  She has had her business open for more that 10 years, and it has served to cover her expenses, since she lives alone.

This loan will be used to buy sodas, water, fruits, sugar, etc. to prepare delicious ice creams.  She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans have helped her to get ahead in life.
 
Her dreams are to continue moving forward and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy sodas, water, fruit, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Verónica Johanna

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene dos  hijos, uno de 7 años  y un bebé de 6 meses, su hijo mayor estudia en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, compra y vende maíz, balanceado y otros alimentos para animales de granja, este negocio es muy bueno ya que la mayoría de las personas de su localidad se dedican a la cría de animales por lo cual sus ventas están aseguradas. A ella le gusta lo que hace ya que se gana algo sin tener que salir de su casa, esto le permite además estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos y de su hogar. Lleva más de tres años con su  negocio el mismo que le deja muy buenas ganancias.

Va a utilizar este crédito para comprar maíz, balanceado y arrocillo. Lleva más de tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con su primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "María Auxiliadora" meets in the parish of Sequita, which is a part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, a prosperous canton known for the famous woven straw hats that are appreciated by people near and far.

This is where Verónica a 28 year old woman, lives.  She is married and has two children, one is 7 years old, and the other is a baby of 6 months, and her older child studies in school.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

In order to make some money of her own and to help her husband with the household expenses, she works in sales.  She buys and sells corn, feed supplements, and other nutritional products for farm animals.  This business is really good because the majority of people in her area work in animal husbandry, so her sales are well assured.  She likes the work that she does, since she can make money without having to leave the house, which also allows her to be available for meeting the needs of her children and the household.  She has been in this work for more than three years and she is making a good income.

She will use this loan to buy corn, feed supplements, and straw.  She has been with the communal bank for more than three years, and she likes it because her first loan allowed her to open her business.
 
Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: Comprar maíz, balanceados y arrocillo.

loans.name: María Gabriela

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Trabajando Para Un Futuro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 6 años que estudia en escuela. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña María en sociedad con su suegro tienen  una tienda de víveres en la casa de su suegro, allí venden toda clase de víveres, algunos remedios y tarjetas telefónicas que  les da ganancias extra. Esta vez realiza el crédito tanto para surtir aun mas su tienda y también para darle a su esposo el cual se dedica a sembrar, él necesita preparar el terreno en el cual va a sembrar cebolla perla. 

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que el anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para aumentar más productos en su tienda los mismos que le dejaron muy buenos ingresos. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres y pagar la mano de obra para prepara el terreno de su esposo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of Trabajando para un Futuro Communal Bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton, a place known for the delicious locally-made sweets that are known all over the country and for the warmth of its hardworking and kind people.

This is where María lives.  She's 27 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has a six-year-old child, who is in school.  Her husband makes a living in agriculture.

María and her father-in-law have a grocery store in his house where they sell all types of provisions, some medicine, and telephone cards, which give them extra profits.  She needs this loan not only to stock her business even more but also to give to her husband, who needs to prepare the plot of land on which he's going to plant pearl onion.

She's getting another loan because the first one was so useful to her in expanding the products in her store, which gave her very good income.  She's going to use this loan to buy provisions and pay laborers to prepare her husband's plot of land.

She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help they give her with the loans.  Her objective is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions and to pay for labor

loans.name: María Yomaira

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Trabajando Para Un Futuro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  7, 5 y 1 año de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo en su labor, él se dedica a la agricultura y en la actualidad necesitan el crédito para el pago de mano de obra para lo que es el des brote de maleza y arreglos de varias parcelas para volver a sembrar, ellos quieren aprovechara el invierno y sembrar maíz en unas tierras altas que tienen y arroz en las parcelas donde se puede regar. Ellos siembran en toda época del año pues cuentan con los equipos de bombeo de agua.
 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que con al otro crédito se pudo pagar la mano de obra de la recolección de los cultivos, con esto ellos pudieron guardar la cosecha por unos meses y después vendieron a un mejor precio y les quedo mejores ganancias. Este crédito es para pago de mano de obra. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella puede ayudar a su marido.
 
Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Trabajando Para Un Futuro [Working for a Future] meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte canton. Rocafuerte is famous all over the country for its delicious sweets made by the locals, as well as the warmth of its kind and hard-working people. 

29-year-old Maria lives here with her husband and their three children aged 7, 5, and 1. Her husband works in farming, and they need a loan to pay for labor to control the sprouting of weeds and to prepare several plots of land so they are able to sow again. They want to take advantage of the winter and sow corn on high ground and rice in plots where it can be watered. They sow throughout the year because they have water-pumping equipment.

She is requesting another loan because with the previous loan she was able to pay for labor to harvest the crop. They managed to store the harvest for a few months and then sold it at better prices and got higher profits. This loan is again for labor costs. She has been a member of the communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because she can use the loans to help her husband out.

Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to pay for labor to sow corn and rice.

loans.name: Angela Yahaira

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Trabajando Para Un Futuro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar vive la señora Angela, tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 7 y 6 años de edad los mismos que  estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es maestro cerrajero.

Ella es  una muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo, él tiene un taller de cerrajería en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos con el metal como puertas, ventanas, estructuras y otras cosas, trabaja de lunes  a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, trabaja con la ayuda de dos personas a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal, ella también se dedica a la cría de gallinas y otras aves de corral con los cual se gana sus propios ingresos.  Su esposo tiene este taller ya por 7 años y nunca le ha faltado trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar hierro, soldaduras, pinturas, entre otros materiales necesarios en este tipo de trabajos. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos les ayudan mucho.
 
Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que arriendan donde viven.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte the members of the communal bank Trabanjando Para Un Futuro meet twice a month. This place is known for its delicious sweets that the locals prepare and it is known throughout the country for the warmth of its friendly working people.

Angela lives here. She is 31 years old, has a common-law marriage, and they have three children 11, 7, and 6 years of age who are school students. Her husband is a master locksmith.

She is a very good housewife who is taking a loan in order to help her husband. He has a locksmith shop and does a variety of work with metal such as doors, windows, structures and other things. He works from Monday through Saturday from 8:00AM until 6:00PM, working with the help of two people who are paid a weekly salary. She works too raising chickens and other poultry to earn her own income. Her husband has had his workshop for seven years and has never lacked for work.

This loan is to buy iron, welding materials, paint, and other necessary supplies for this type of work. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are very helpful.

Her dream is to have her own house because they pay rent where they live.

loans.use: to buy iron, welding materials, paint and other supplies for her husband's workshop which he owns

loans.name: Reyna Judid

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Reyna, tiene 62  años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su marido trabaja en la empresa de agua potable.

Doña Reyna para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder contribuir con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende frutas y legumbres, trabaja los viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 5h00 hasta las 18h00, además de esto ella también vende ropa de todo tipo en los días que no está en el mercado, la ropa  vende en Pedernales ciudad a la que viaja todos los lunes y regresa los jueves al medio día, se queda en esa ciudad realizando ventas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella lleva más de 15 años dedicada al comercio.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito porque es así como logra financiar sus negocios y salir adelante, el crédito anterior le ayudo ya que estuvo bastante enferma y las ganancias le sirvieron para gastos de médicos y medicinas,  a pesar de esto ella no tuvo atrasos en sus pagos. Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y ropa  que es lo que más ganancias le dejan. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda o un  bazar.
texts.en:
The communal bank “La Rosa de Guadalupe” meets twice a month in the city of Charapoto. This city is known for its traditional culture. In addition, two of the best beaches in the province are located a few minutes away – San Jacinto and San Clemente. 

Reyna lives here. She is 62 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three adult children, one of them still living at home. Her husband works in the drinking water business.

Reyna, in order to earn her own income and thus be able to contribute to the household expenses, has a stall at the market where she sells fruits and vegetables, working Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 5:00AM until 6:00PM. She also sells typical clothing on the days when she is not at the market. She sells the clothing in the city of Pedernales where she goes every Monday returning on Thursdays at noon, staying in that city to conduct sales and to collect payments as she extends credit and collects payment every eight days. She has been in business for more than fifteen years.

She is repeating her loan because this is how she can finance her businesses and get ahead. The previous loan helped her as she was very ill and the earnings helped her pay for medical expenses and medicine. Despite this, she was not late making her payments. This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables, and clothing so she can earn more profit. She has been with the communal bank more than two years and she likes the assistance the loans have given her.

Her dream is to have a store or a bazaar.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her market stall Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, and to buy clothing which she sells from Monday-Thursday

loans.name: Jully Karina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Jully, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 18 y 9 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en universidad  y el menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en la Empresa Eléctrica.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y sentirse independiente  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda. Trabaja tres  días de la semana y en horarios variados, deja a crédito su mercadería y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito con el Banco Comunal ya que con el crédito anterior ella pudo ir  a Guayaquil a comprar sus prendas y al comprar de contado todo le salió más barato incluso compro carteras y varios accesorios los cuales también  está vendiendo en la actualidad y  le está dejando mejores ingresos los cuales los utiliza para los gastos de estudios de sus hijos ya que esto es lo más importante para ella, este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, carteras y accesorios de damas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de dos años, es la presidenta del mismo  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The “La Rosa de Guadalupe” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto which is very well known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.  Jully, 38, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are 19, 18 and 9 years of age. The two older ones attend university and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband works for the electric company.

In order to earn a bit on her own and to feel independent, she sells all types of clothes door to door and also at home where her customers come by when they need some article of clothing.  She works three days a week on varying schedules.  She sells her merchandise on credit and collects bi-weekly.  She goes to Guayaquil every two weeks or monthly to buy merchandise as needed.  She’s been in business five years and does very well.

She’s repeating her loan with the communal bank because she was able to use the previous one to go to Guayaquil to buy clothes and by being able to pay cash everything was less expensive; she even bought purses and several accessories that she’s also selling now and are producing higher income that she will use to buy merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, purses and women’s accessories.

She’s been in the communal bank for more than two years and is its president; she likes it because of the help she gets from the loans.  Her dream is that her children complete their education and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, purses and women's accessories.

loans.name: Nancy Mabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 20, 19 y 8 años de edad, todos  estudian en universidad  colegio y escuela el menor. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.
 
Doña Nancy hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad, al ver que su esposo no tiene trabajo seguro  ella puso un pequeño taller de costura en el cual  confecciona todo tipo de ropa. Ella también está estudiando párvulo y trabaja en una escuela de la localidad en la cual espera algún dia tener un nombramiento del estado para así asegurar su futuro.  Con el duro trabajo de su taller ella ayuda a sus hijos en sus estudios y se ayuda ella para culminar sus propios estudios.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas, hilos, botones y varios materiales más de costura. Lleva cuatro ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un nombramiento de maestra en la escuela donde labora.
texts.en:
The “La Rosa De Guadalupe” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture and also for being located a few minutes away from the best beaches in the San Jacinto and San Clemente province.

Nancy is 40 years old and lives here.  She’s married and has three children, ages 20, 19, and 18; all attend school or study at university.  Her husband works on occasion. 

Nancy learned sewing and clothes making at a local academy and set up a small workshop when she saw that her husband was not able to find work.  She is also studying child development and works at a local nursery school in hopes of securing her future by one day obtaining a government position.  Through her hard work in her workshop, she helps her children with their education and also helps herself to culminate her own studies.
 
She will use the money from this loan to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, and various sewing supplies.  She has been with the communal bank for four cycles and she enjoys it because of the help she gets through the loans.

Her dream is to be named as a teacher at the school where she works.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Dieab's Group

texts.en: A citizen residing in a rural village of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province in Cambodia, Dieab is a 50-year-old widow with four children. Some of her children are employed as paid workers in Phonm Penh (capital city of Cambodia) and some are students. To generate resources needed for her home, Dieab has a business selling grocery items which enables her to earn around 26,000KHR per day. Dieab is leading a loan group of three female members, who all have been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for six loan cycles already, to take out a loan in the amount of 1,400,000KHR each. The previous loans have enabled the group representative, Dieab, to see the improvement in her family's living standard. Dieab will spend some portion of her loan portion on purchasing more grocery items such as sugar, salt, shampoo, soap, instant noodle, canned items, etc. to sell in order to make her customers satisfied. In hope of offering a bright future for her beloved children, the other portion of the loan will be spent on covering the fees of her children's schooling. Dieab's biggest hope is, after receiving her requested loan portion, to be able to support her children's education and help them pursue it as far as possible.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Sokhon is 55 years of age and married. She and her family live in Battambang province's Thmor Koul district in Cambodia. Sokhon has two sons and three daughters, all of whom are students.
