To earn a living for the family, Sokhon sells fish and her husband farms rice on a two-hectare plot of farmland. This will be Sokhon's sixth time requesting a loan via VisionFund, Kiva's partner. The previous loans have enabled her to keep her beloved children in school and, thanks to those loans, succeeded with one extra thing: securing food needs for her family. Now Sokhon is requesting a KHR 2,000,000 loan to support her husband's business by purchasing fertilizer. With the help of this loan, Sokhon hopes that her husband can smoothly run his business, adding more income to the family. She will also use the income generated by her business and her husband's to help keep her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mach

texts.en: A villager living in a rural village of Kandal Stoeng district located in Kandal province in Cambodia, Mach is a 48-year-old married woman with two children. Mach and her husband earn their living by farming rice, the business in which they have been involving for more than 25 years, earning around 7USD per day. Mach has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for six loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in securing food needs for her family. Now she is in need of money to purchase a motorbike for her children. Thus, she is requesting a USD 800 loan. After receiving this loan and using it as she plans, she would be very happy to be able to help make her children's transportation from home to workplace much easier.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en: Yorn is 29 years old and married. He and his family reside in Kandal province's Kandal Stoeng district in Cambodia. He is blessed with a lovely daughter and a son, both of whom are students and still under his responsibility. To gain income for the family, he works as a rice farmer and a construction worker. His wife complements the income by working as a tailor. Together, they are able to earn around 18,000KHR and save approximately 6,000KHR after offsetting the daily expenses. Yorn, a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), is leading a group member who also is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund to take out a loan in the amount of 600,000KHR each. The past loans that he already obtained and successfully paid back have allowed him to improve the living standard of his family. Now with his requested loan portion, he will spend on buying fertilizer and paying the cost of labor. In the near future, he believes that with the help of this loan he will be able to increase his crop yields and earn more income for the family. He is also willing to use the anticipated income to help keep his beloved children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for the cost of labor

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok, 26 years old and a mother of one son, lives in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She and her husband have struggled to cover their daily costs of living through rice farming, pig raising, and producing sugar from palm juice. 

Her current business earns her up to 9,900 KHR. Sok, in a group of two, is in the first cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She is seeking 3,000,000 KHR whereas her co-borrower is requesting 2,000,000 KHR. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a buffalo in order to support her rice farming. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so she can uplift her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Bunran

texts.en:
A 21-year-old married woman named Bunran lives in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district located in Battambang province in Cambodia. She is blessed with a son who is still under her responsibility. To gain resources needed for the family, Bunran and her husband work as rice farmers on a two-hectare plot of farm. 

Her husband is also employed as a paid worker in order to add more income to the family. This hard-working couple is able to earn around 50,000KHR and manages to save approximately 26,000KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

This is Bunran's first time requesting loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She is applying for a KHR 601,000 loan. With this loan, Bunran will spend some portion of it on buying fertilizer and rice seed to help keep her family's rice-growing business in good shape. The other portion of the loan will be spent on covering the cost of gasoline. Bunran hopes that via the help of this loan, her rice field will provide her with a good-quality crop so that she can sell it at a good price and earn more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en: A 42 years old mother of seven children, Sarun is one of the breadwinners of her family and lives in Pursat Province (Cambodia). To earn a living for her children's sake, she has been growing rice, raising pigs, and trading rice for 10 years. This is the seventh loan cycle for Sarun with VisionFund. She has managed her business gradually from the past loans, which she has paid back completely. Now, she forms a group to seek a new loan. There are two members in her group and she is the leader. This cycle, her requesting loan amount is 4,000,000 KHR while her co-borrower's requesting amount is 1,000,000 KHR. Sarun is going to use this portion to buy fertilizer and buy a small rice milling machine. She hopes that she can gain high crop yields so she can make more income for her children's sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and buy a rice milling machine

loans.name: Sreynut's Group

texts.en:
Sreynut is 32 years old and a citizen of the Pursat Province's Kror Kor district of Cambodia.  She has three children; some are in school and others are too young for schooling. 

Sreynut has been a rice farmer for seven years.  It is her family's main source of income.  She also runs a small grocery stall at home to generate extra income.  Sreynut earn up to 12,800 KHR per day. 

Currently, her family's situation is getting better because of her first loan, that she paid back with success.  She is in the second loan-cycle and the leader in this group that consists of three members. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy more grocery items such as canned food, instant noodles, beverages, etc.  She hopes this will help her to refill her grocery stall, so she can make more income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items.

loans.name: Samy's Group

texts.en:
A widow mother of three children, originally from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Samy, age 47, is a diligent farmer who tends two hectares of farmland.  

To overcome her family's hardship as a single mother, Samy has run her business for almost 30 years.  She is able to earn up to 13,800 KHR per day. 

Samy is the group leader and there are two members in her group include her; both of them are second-time borrowers with VisionFund.  

Her last loan has been paid back and helped her support her business and sustain her household.  Now, Samy is seeking 500,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting 550,000 KHR.  Samy is going to use her portion to purchase potash for her rice farm.  She hopes to boost her crop output and provide a high yield and larger income.

loans.use: to purchase potash for her rice farm.

loans.name: Chrib

texts.en:
Chrib is a local farmer from Pursat Province (Cambodia), where rice farming is a common business in her village. She is 31 years old, a married mother blessed with three children.  Two of the children are students; the remaining one is still little. 

Chrib has been rice farming for 12 years, with the support from her husband. He also works for others - for a fee - during his spare time from the rice field. She is able to earn up to 15,300 KHR per day from the business. Her main challenge is a shortage of working capital to support her rice farm. Therefore, she is applying for a new loan. 

This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva's partner).  She used her past loan, which she has paid back, in a wise manner to upgrade her living conditions. Now she is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan; she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will use a portion of it to build a decent latrine for her family, especially her children. She hopes to receive an increased yield on her farmland, and have a hygenic living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap is 38 years old and has three dependent children who are still in school. She and her husband make a living through raising ducks, which she has been engaged in for 6 years. This is the sixth-cycle loan for Sopheap with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. After the successful loans that has provided her with decent food for her children, she feels so confident that she can maintain her living conditions better than before. Now, in a group of two to apply for a new loan, she is leader. For Sopheap, she is going to use her portion to buy duck feed. She hopes this feed with fatten her duck so it can lay more eggs for her to resell with more income to sustain her family.

loans.use: To buy duck feed

loans.name: Chhoum

texts.en: Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chhoum is 52 years old and a father of one son. His main sources of income are from two hectares of rice farming and from selling grocery items. He has engaged in these businesses for 10 years. Three cycles ago was his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). He has used his loan wisely in order to relieve his family burden and improve its livelihood. Now, he is seeking for 1,500,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for his rice. He hopes to mount up his crop production and sell with high prices so as he can maintain his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his rice

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: A 31-year-old married woman named Chreb resides in a rural area of Kror Kor district located Pursat province in Cambodia. She has one daughter and two sons, all of whom are dependent on her. Of her children, two are currently in school. To offer a decent life for her family, Chreb works as a rice farmer on a hectare of farmland, earning around 9,000KHR per day and saving approximately 3,000KHR after offsetting her daily cost of living. Chreb's husband works as a fisherman in order to add more income to the family. Chreb has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in securing food needs for her family. In hope of helping her husband runs his business smoothly, Chreb is now leading a loan group of three members to take out a loan in the amount of 2,200,000KHR in total. This group representative (Chreb) will use the loan portion of her loan, which is 700,000KHR, to purchase fishing materials such as fish traps and cast net. With the help of this loan, Chreb hopes that her husband's business will provide greater income. She will use the income generated by her business and her husband's to improve the living conditions of her family and, most importantly, keep her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
A young widow and mother of two (one small child and a school-age child), Chreb is 27 years old and lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province.  She is engaged in rice farming, one of the popular businesses in her neighborhood. She has two hectares of farmland for a rice paddy, and a small grocery stall for extra income. She been in this business for 7 years. 

Chreb's group consists of four female members; three members, including her, are third-cycle borrowers, while the remaining one is a seven-time borrower. Her past loan has helped her to support her family with good living conditions. 

The entire amount of the loan being requesting by her group is 15,000,000 KHR.  Chreb's loan portion is 3,000,000 KHR and it will be spent to purchase potash (fertilizer) for her farmland. She will also use a portion of it to buy more grocery items for resale in her stall. 

She hopes this purchase will help her boost her crop output, and support her grocery-selling business at the same time. By doing so, she can sustain her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and grocery items for her grocery stall.

loans.name: Seanghai

texts.en:
Residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Seanghai is 26 years old and a hardworking farmer who dedicates all her income for her family primarily to her son. To cover the daily cost of living, she grows rice, pineapples, and raises pigs. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. 

Seanghai's past loan was the original loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). That past loan, which has better supported her business as well as her household, has been completely paid back with success. Now, she is requesting another loan for 2,700,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and pig feed. She hopes that she can make more income from her current business. Therefore, she can keep sustaining her cost of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Ram's Group

texts.en: Ram, age 45 and a married mother of three children, is a rural villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She deals with her daily financial difficulties through four hectares of rice cropping while her husband catches fishes for resale. After 20 years of experiences in this business, she is able to earn up to 23,300 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Ram's group consisting of two members with Ram as the leader. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. With her loan portion, she is going to buy fertilizer and insecticides, and will pay a transplanting fee. She hopes this purchase will enlarge her crop production and return her a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides, and to pay for transplanting

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 53 years old, is the very jolly and responsible parent of three grown children from the mountainous province of Isabela. 

She has been engaged in raising hogs for 2 years. She fattens them and sells them to have income and sustain her family. 

She is asking a loan of PHP10,000 to buy feed and piglets to expand her business so that she can sustain her family.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets for her business.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Sina is 29 years old and married with two small children. She and her husband earn a living by working construction, which they have been doing for ten years. Together, they can earn about KHR35,000 per day to feed the family; they manage to save about KHR20,000 each day for future needs. 

Sina's group consists of four members who live in the same area.   They all have been members of VisionFund for one cycle. After a successful loan from VisionFund, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. She will use her portion, in addition to her savings, to buy a motorbike for commuting to work. This loan will enable her to own transportation to commute to work on a timely and regular basis,  and will provide more time to better care for her children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en: Prima is a very hardworking and loving woman. Being a mother, she will do anything to sustain the needs of her family. She has been engaged in hog-raising for five years. She fattens the pigs and sells them when they are big. Aside from hog-raising, she also manages a small store in front of her house. Prima is asking for a loan amount of 15,000 PHP to buy feed and piglets to raise and sell to have additional income so that she can fulfill the needs of her family. In the future, Prima prays that her business will expand so that she can fulfill all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets for her business

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en:
Sothy, 26, is a married mother of two dependent children who are too young for schooling. Livng in a rural village of the Pursat province's Sampov Meas district, Sothy is a rice farmer. She has three hectares of farmland and has been in this primary business for about four years while her husband is a paid worker to help generate more income for the family. 

Sothy has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and she completely paid back the past two loans which have helped her better support her business. She is now leading a group of three who live in the same area to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to hire laborers to prepare her land for cultivation. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to fulfill her dream of running a grocery store.

loans.use: to hire laborers to prepare her land for cultivation.

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Mongkol Borey district, Navy is 50 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is still dependent on her while the other has his own employment. To make a living, she and her husband have been cultivating rice for almost 30 years. With the current business, she manages to earn about KHR 12,000 per day and can save about KHR 5,000 each day for future needs. 

This is a small group loan for Navy's group of two. She is a third cycled client while her co-member is a fourth cycled client with VisionFund. They both completely paid back previous loans. Navy successfully used the loans to better support her livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan, She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her yields and sell her crop for a good price so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural village of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province in Cambodia, Heang is a 59-year-old widow. To earn a living, she has been farming rice and selling vegetables and fruits for 10 years, earning approximately 12,000 KHR and saving around 7,000 KHR for future needs after offsetting her daily expenses. This is Heang's fourth time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past loans have made Heang so satisfied that she was able to improve her living standard so much better. Now she is leading a loan group of four female members to apply for a loan in the amount of 4,800,000 KHR total. With this new requested loan portion, Heang will buy fertilizer and pesticide and cover the cost of labor. The other portion of the loan will be spent on purchasing more vegetables and fruits to sell. This group leader, Heang, hopes that, after receiving the loan and efficiently using it, her rice-growing business will provide a good quality yield so that she can sell her crop at good prices, earning even more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Veth

texts.en: Veth is a resident residing in a rural area of Dambae district located in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is 30 years old and married with three daughters, all of whom are dependent on her and currently in school. To offer a decent life for her family, she has been farming rice and planting cassava for one year. Her husband helps complement the family's income by selling salt. She is now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, for the first time in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she will utilize some portion of it to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay labor fees. She will also use the other portion of the loan to help support her husband's business by buying more salt for him to sell. In the future, Veth hopes that, after receiving the loan and wisely using it, her business as well as her husband's will generate more income so that she can keep her kids in school and, hopefully, be able to save some money in order to buy a truck to help her husband conveniently deliver the salt.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en:
Ratha, 28, lives in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district of Pursat province. He is married with two sons. He and his wife earn a living by farming rice and planting vegetables. Having been in the business for about five years, he can earn about KHR36,000 per day; he manages to save about KHR20,000 each day for future needs. 

Ratha's group consists of two people. He has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles; the other group member is in the second cycle. Ratha successfully used past loans to better support his living conditions,  and to buy some basic household necessities for the family.

He is now leading his group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. He will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland. 

He hopes to increase his business, and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Koeurn's Group

texts.en:
Koeurn, 42, is a permanent villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She provides for her family's daily basic needs by working both as a farmer on two hectares of rice fields and as a paid worker. She has six children to support; some of them are still in school, while others help with the family business. She has been involved in this business for 10 years, earning about 19,400 KHR per day. 

Koeurn's group consists of two female members; she is the leader. She is a seventh-cycle client who has paid back her past loans already. Her past loans have helped her develop her current business and her household. Now, she and her co-borrower, who is a first-cycle borrower, are applying for 1,300,000 KHR and 200,000 KHR, respectively. Koeurn's loan portion will used to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She hopes to minimize the loss due to pests and increase her farm's productivity so she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her crops.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A 46-year-old mother living in Ek Phnom district, Battambang Province, Mom is a local farmer who grows rice as her main source of income. She has four children, only one of whom is under her responsibility; this son is still in school. During her free time, she earns extra income by working for others. 

Now, she is asking for a loan with another woman. She is a third-time borrower, whereas her team member is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Mom has managed her past loan wisely in order to support her business well. Now, she is seeking 300,000 KHR; her co-borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader of her group, she is going to use her portion to buy three sacks of fertilizer for her cash crop. She hopes this purchase will help her to increase her crop output and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer for her cash crops.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly is 48 years old and has two children. She sells food along the street in order to support her children, which she has been doing for six years. 

Ly's group, consisting of two members, is requesting its third loan for 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more ingredients to make food to sell. She hopes this loan will support her business, so she can triple her income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, is 29 years old and strives to make a living by catching fish for resale. With 12 years of experience in this business, she is able to earn 29,000 KHR per day. 

Lacking working capital to support her fishing business, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. Mao is in her fourth cycle, and her remaining two members have just joined VisionFund(Kiva's partner) this cycle. She feels so confident in upgrading her living conditions after the past loan, which she has repaid. 

As the leader, she is going to use this loan cycle to buy more fishing materials, including a fishing outfit, net, etc. She hopes to catch more fish so she can increase the income for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Savorn, 54, is a widow and mother of six children.  She manages one hectare of rice farmland to cover her daily cost of living.  Savorn is able to earn about 23,600 KHR per day.  

This is the second loan for Savorn's group.  She used her first loan to support the needs of her family and cover the expenses of her rice growing business. 

For this loan cycle, she is seeking 400,000 KHR and her fellow group member is applying for 700,000 KHR.  As the leader, Savorn is going use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland.  She expects to earn a larger income to maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
A local citizen from Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Phorn is 59 years old and has two children. To provide for the daily financial need for food, she and her husband grow rice, from which she is able to earn up to 29,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. She has five years experience in this business. 

She has been with VisionFund for past three loan cycles and has completely paid back the loans. The past loan has empowered her to sustain better living conditions gradually. Now, she forms a group of three to seek a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy two sacks of fertilizer for her cash crop. She hopes to earn more income from her current business, so she can set aside some money to fill up the ditch surrounding her house and build a new house.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer for her cash crop.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Samath's Group

texts.en: SamAth is a father of a young son and is a citizen from Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province (Cambodia). To cover the daily cost of living, he does rice cropping with support from his wife. He has been involved in this business for five years and is able to save up to 20,000 KHR per day currently. SamAth leads a group of six members. He is a sixth-cycle loan client who has paid back his past loan successfully. The loans have better sustained his business and upgraded his living conditions. For this cycle, he and four other members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each while his remaining co-borrower is applying for 600,000 KHR. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy six sacks of fertilizer for his farmland and to start a small grocery stall for extra income. He hopes to earn more income so that he can build on his savings to fix his house in a proper condition.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of fertilizer for her farmland and start a small grocery stall.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 38 years old and lives in Bagong Silang with her husband and four school-aged children. She describes herself as a hard worker and one who wants to move her family ahead in life. For about the last three years she has been working as a housekeeper, where she does all types of work. 

At present, she is engaged in her wood lamination business. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of wood and other materials needed in wood lamination to allow her to do a better job. By purchasing these items, she will improve the quality of her work and have more customers. Her dream is to have her own premises to set up her carpentry shop in a better way, and to help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy wood and glue for her wood lamination

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 44 years old, from the village of Bagong Silang, in the province of Isabela, and is married to Nestor. She lives in her own home with her life partner and three grown children. She has a wood lamination business that she attends to every day with dedication with the help of her children. Marilyn's business is located in a very rural area, where she is surrounded by many farms. In addition to this business, she has her own corn farm. Marilyn is an exemplary woman who never get tired of working and earning for a living. She has decided to request a loan of 13,000 PHP so the business will become stronger. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of wood, glue and other needs for wood lamination. In this way, she hopes to improve her sales, her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials for her wood lamination business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Ever since Marcelina, 41 years old, was very little, she really liked the art of welding. That is why she thought of having her own business making gates and windows. Her husband and daughter help her with the business, specifically with customer relations. That is why Marcelina does her work with great enthusiasm and dedication. In order to continue with her business, Marcelina wants a loan to buy hoses and a welding machine for her welding shop. Her big dream is to have a well-established business and a good quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy hoses and a welding machine

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 56 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a retail store selling a variety of goods in the local community. She sells fruits, vegetables, and other basic commodities. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from this activity. Norma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned good, noodles, coffee and sugar for her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, noodles, coffee and sugar for her store

location.town: Cabisera 5, Baribad, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is a 50-year-old, married man living in Namnama village in the Isabela area. Warlito and his wife are the loving parents of four children. He lives with his wife, his children, his parents, and his brother. He explains that he is a responsible and goal-oriented person.

To earn a living, he is involved in the farming industry. Warlito primarily grows corn. 

Warlito would like to buy corn seeds and fertilizers to treat the land in order to experience a good harvest. He also needs money to pay for his employees' work. As a result, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 PHP. Warlito thanks all lenders who support him.

loans.use: to expand and improve his farming operations by purchasing corn seeds and fertilizer and by paying labor costs

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hard-working woman who dreams of seeing her two children finish their college education. She is 42 years old and married to Roosevelt who is also her business partner. Their children are Sheila Mae and Lara Kaye. 

Her family lives in a community surrounded by hospitable, responsible and God-fearing people. She and her husband are engaged in farming, which is their major source of income, but with their desire to provide a better life for their family, they also engage in other businesses such as hog raising, furniture making, welding and running a small store in their village. Delia's products include basic commodities, rice, soft drinks, personal care items and hog feed.

Delia is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used in their farm business since their income is not enough to sustain the next planting season. She hopes that through her loan, their economic status will improve

loans.use: To buy sacks of seed and fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: El señor Alexander tiene 30 años de edad es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres con su hermano mayor Ovidio y el domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad de Vallecito a unos 35 km de la Ciudad de Monteagudo. Su principal actividad de Alexander es la cría de cerdos cabañeros, los cría en corrales rústicos es por eso que esta solicitando crédito para poder mejorarlos y también comprar alimento balanceado por que tiene cerdas que se encuentran en etapa gestación, para que así no se mueran de hambre los lechones cuando nazcan. Alexander y Ovidio son los dos hijos que están al lado de sus padres aunque tienen otros hijos pero ellos solo vienen a verlos no mas es por eso que ellos se dedican a la crianza de cerdos cabañeros para que puedan obtener ingresos y así puedan cubrir gastos de sus padres en alimentación, ropa y así tener una vida saludable para su familia.
texts.en:
Alexander is 30 years old and single.  He lives in his parents' home together with his older brother Ovidio.  Their home is located in the community of Vallecito, some 35km from the city of Monteagudo.  Alexander's main business activity is raising 'cabañero' pigs.  He raises them in rustic pens and is requesting this loan to improve the pens and to buy nutritionally-balanced feed because he has some pregnant pigs and he doesn't want the piglets to die of hunger when they are born.

Alexander and Ovidio are the two children who still live at home with their parents.  Their parents have other children but they only come to visit. For this reason, the pair raise 'cabañero' pigs so that they can make income and cover their parents' food and clothing expenses so that their family can lead a good life.

loans.use: to build a pen and buy nutritionally-balanced feed

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita, hace mas de cinco años que se dedica a la venta de Muebles de Mimbre, cada fin de semana se va a las ferias de la ciudad de Tarija para poder exponer sus productos, y poderlos vender. De estado Civil Separada, su esposo el abandono hace más de 15 años, le pasa una pensión para sus dos hijos pequeños con quienes ella se quedo. De condición humilde, aun no tiene una casa propia, vive en condición de alquilada mas de 5 años en la misma vivienda, por ello quiere incrementar su capital de operación para poder obtener mayores ingresos y de esa manera poder ahorrar un poco mas y adquirir con el tiempo una vivienda propia donde pueda darle a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida y un lugar cómodo donde puedan realizar sus tareas y actividades escolares ya que actualmente no gozan de ese espacio físico de manera correcta y adecuada.
texts.en: Margarita has been selling wicker furniture for more than five years.  She goes to the weekly street markets in the city of Tarija to display her products and be able to sell them.  She’s separated; her husband left her more than 15 years ago.  He sends her child support for their two children who she’s raising.  She’s of humble condition and still does not have a house of her own in the city.  She’s been renting the same house for more than five years.  This is why she wants to increase her operating capital to earn higher profits so she can save a bit more and in time acquire a house of her own where she can give her children better living conditions and a comfortable place where they can do their homework and school activities since they currently don’t have an adequate physical space in which to do so.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make her wicker furniture.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: Don Rolando tiene 52 años de edad, viven en Ticuantepe, es de familia agricultora desde pequeño se dedico al cultivo, su esposa se dedica a la actividad de comercio viaja a vender frutas a uno de los mercados más grandes de Managua, actualmente tienen a su cargo a dos hijos que estudian y los otros ya son mayores e independientes. Este es su 14vo crédito que necesita para sembrar piña, comprara hijos de piña, abono, urea, y realizara el pago a los trabajadores quienes prepararán la tierra, sus planes más a delante es el comprar un pequeño terreno para sembrar mas piña y darle a sus hijos y nietos un buen futuro.
texts.en: Mr. Rolando is 52 years old, he lives in Ticuantepe, he is from a farming family and since he was small he has been farming. His wife travels to sell fruit at one of the largest markets in Managua. They currently take care of two children who both go to school and the others are adults and independent. This is their fourteenth loan and they need it to plant pineapple, purchase pineapple crowns, fertilizer, urea and to pay for the labor that will prepare the land. Rolando's plan is to purchase a small plot of land to plant more pineapples and to give his children and grandchildren a better future.

loans.use: purchase pineapple, fertilizer, urea and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal El Arbolito 4.

En este lugar vive la señora Ruth, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de  una hija de 15 años que estudia en el colegio. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 

Doña Ruth con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y  para que a su hija no le falte nada se dedica al comercio, tiene un puesto en el centro de la ciudad lugar donde muchos comerciantes informales como ella venden sus productos, ella vende ropa de todo tipo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30  hasta las 18h00 hora en que todos los comerciantes cierran sus pequeños negocios aunque ella también vende en su casa si algún cliente conocido necesita de alguna prenda. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada que necesita. Tiene 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y es así como ella lucha todos los días para que a su hija no le falte nada.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Este es su primer ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y espera seguir por mucho tiempo más.

Su sueño es que a su hija no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of El Arbolito 4 Communal Bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí.  For many years, this city has been known as the city of the royal tamarinds.  Ruth, 35 years old, lives in this city.  She is a single mother of a fifteen year old daughter who is a student.  She lives in her parents’ home.
Ruth wants to earn something on her own and with this, be able to get ahead so that her daughter has everything she needs.  So, she has a stand in the city center, a place where many informal merchants like her sell their products.  She sells all types of clothing and works from 8:30 in the morning until 6:00 pm.  All of the merchants close their small businesses at this time but she also conducts sales in her home if a customer needs clothing.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil as needed.  She has been engaged in this activity for fifteen years and strives everyday so that her daughter lacks nothing.
She will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children’s clothing.  This is her first loan cycle with the communal bank and she hopes to continue for much longer.  Her dream is that her daughter doesn’t want for anything.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Johanna Pàola

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal El Arbolito 4.

En este lugar vive la señorita Johanna, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres, ella estudia párvulo en una universidad de esta ciudad. Este es su primer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.

Ella a mas de ser una buena estudiante con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en sus estudios se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo para lo cual tiene un pequeño local en su casa y también les vende a sus compañeras de estudios las cuales son sus mejores clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a él ella ha podido seguir su carrera universitaria y también a podido ayudarles a sus padres.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Sus sueños es terminar sus estudios y conseguir un buen trabajo en alguna institución del gobierno ya que el encantan los niños.
texts.en:
The members of El Arbolito 4 Community Bank meet twice a month in the town of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the home of the Reales Tamarindos soccer team. Señorita Johanna lives there. She is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is studying pre-school education at the local university. This is her first loan cycle with the Bank, and she likes the process as the loans are quick and there's not too much red tape.

As well as being a good student with the goal of getting a good education so she can get ahead, Johanna runs a business selling clothing from a small stall at her home. She also sells the clothing to her fellow students who are her best customers. She lets them have the items on credit and then collects money twice a month. Johanna goes to Guayaquil to buy the clothing whenever it is necessary. It's a job she's been doing for seven years, and thanks to the money she earns she has been able to fund her university courses along with help from her parents.

This loan will enable her to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

Johann's dream is to complete her education and get a good job in a government institution as she loves children.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Honorio Gabriel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal El Arbolito 4.

En este lugar vive el señor Honorio, tiene 21 años de edad, está soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres,  estudia en una  universidad de esta ciudad. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con este crédito espera aumentar su negocio además por que los intereses son muy bajos.

Él además de estudiar también se dedica al comercio, tiene un bar en su casa en el cual vende sodas, aguas y otras bebidas, también en su casa ha construido un corral en el cual se dedica a la cría de chanchos los mismos que le dejan muy buenas ganancias y con esto puede pagar sus estudios universitarios. Lleva más de 4 años dedicado a sus negocios.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar gaseosas, aguas, jugos, energizantes y comida para los chanchos. 

Su sueño es terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of real tamarinds, the group El Arbolito 4 (The little tree) meets every 15 days. 

It is here that Mr. Honorio, who is 21 years old, a bachelor and lives at home with his parents. He studies at the university. This is his first loan with the communal bank and he likes it because this loan will help him to expand his business, he also likes to low interest rates. 

Besides studying, he also runs a small business. He has a bar in his house where he sells sodas, water and other drinks. He has also made a farmyard in which he raises livestock from which he makes a good profit. It is with this profit that he is able to pay for his studies. He has been running his businesses for four years. 

This loan will be used to purchase soft drinks, water, juices, energy drinks and food for the livestock. 

His dream is to finish his studies.

loans.use: purchase soft drinks, water, juices, energy drinks and food to feed livestock.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma operates her own general store, which is located in front of their house. She began operating her retailing business in 1990 and it is presently doing great. She hopes to take a loan of PHP 15,000 to maintain and further expand her business. She hopes that her income will increase to provide sufficient needs for her family. Norma describes herself as a jolly person who frequently makes her children laugh. She is happily married and has five children. Some of her children are studying and some are still infants. She dreams of sending all her children to college someday, which is the reason that she is already preparing herself by engaging in business. Their family lives peacefully in the village of La Salette in the province of Isabela.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, drinks and spices for her store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 35-year-old married woman. She and her husband have three school-age children. As a mother, Lilia never loses hope in trying to achieve success and to meet her children's needs. She knows that she needs to be strong and patient in dealing with her responsibilities. She wants to provide for her family, and especially her children, because their future depends on them as parents. 

To earn a living, Lilia operates her own variety store located just in front of their house. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP to maintain and further improve her retail business. Specifically, she wants to buy more stocks of products for her store, including spices, snack foods, and beverages. Her income from the business is being used to sustain the daily needs of her children and she hopes that, with the help of the loan, they will all benefit.

loans.use: to improve her store by purchasing additional inventory such as spices, snack foods, and beverages

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is a simple man but full of hope. He always believes in the saying “if others can, why can’t he?” Loreto is married to Josephine, who is working as a recruiter of domestic helpers who want to work abroad. They are blessed with three healthy children. They live in Barangay Rizal, one of the farthest barangays in Quirino province where farming is the major source of livelihood.

Loreto works as a farmer in their village. However, his income is not enough to meet all the needs of his family. So he and his wife decided to engage in another business that would generate additional income. He requests a loan of PHP 20,000, which they can use to put up a sari-sari store (a community-based store) in their village. They plan to sell basic commodities needed in their community.

loans.use: To purchase basic commodities for sale in their retail store like drinks, foods and spices

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios and her husband work together as farmers. Their marriage has been blessed with six children, two sons and four daughters. They have three grandchildren. Their family happily lives in Barangay Rizal province Isabela. Here, people are united in their work for their community and for their families.

Aside from farming, Remedios and her husband also raise two hogs and vend cogon (a native grass). The couple is doing everything they can to earn a living.

In order to avoid asking for credit from traders, Remedios would like to take this opportunity to request a loan of PHP 30,000. This will provide for their farm and help to maintain their hog-raising business.

Remedios said that they must work hard in order to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snack foods, spices and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
Zef is a 38-year-old married father of two; his children are seven and four years old and all of his family lives in northern Albania. Before coming to the new location, they lived in a very rural area right on top of a major mountain. Like any underdeveloped nation, Albania suffered from lack of good paved roads to connect smaller towns and less populated areas; therefore, life in this areas was not easy at all, in addition to cold weather conditions.
In the new location, Zef established a good business sometime ago, and it seems that it has been going well despite that a few times his plantation was damaged because it was not any fence around it. He planted fruit trees and grapevines and he sells those fruits to local stores and grapes to people who want to make wine.
Zef now wants to prevent further damaging of the plantation and requests a loan to build a fence around it.

loans.use: To build a fence around his plantation, in order to prevent further damage

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and lives in the suburbs in a little town in central Albania. About a year ago, she opened a hairdressing/beauty salon that is the only one in the suburbs and is very frequented by locals. Marte works there with her mother-in-law and they are very busy, yet at times the accessories or tools they use in their profession are not enough, and this causes delays in their service.

Since they feel they have worked hard to establish a good and steady clientele, they don’t want to lose their clientele now. For this reason, Marte decided to request a loan to buy whatever they need in their profession to speed up their service and deserve the “customer oriented” slogan they have created for their business.

The amount of the loan Marte is requesting is 150,000 Albanian Lek. She hopes that their services will be improved with the purchase of her profession’s accessories and tools.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and tools for her beauty/hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Fermina Domitila

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Corazón  Mejía.

En este lugar vive la señora Fermina, tiene 59 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene ocho hijos todos mayores de edad, el menor de de ellos aun vive con ellos  El marido es comerciante.
 
Doña Fermina como buena  esposa realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, el cual tiene un puesto en el mercado  de la ciudad donde vende frutas y verduras. Trabaja todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 14h00, él  se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes lo mejor por lo cual el siempre tiene muchos clientes, lleva en este negocio más de 25  años y es así como nunca les falto el pan en su mesa.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar frutas y verduras. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace mas de 10 ciclos y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos el negocio ha mejorado mucho.
  
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
In Mejía, located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city where people mostly work in agriculture and growing and selling coconuts, the communal bank “Corazón Mejía” meets twice a month. 

Fermina lives here. She is 59 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has eight adult aged children, the youngest of them still living with them. Her husband is a businessman.

Fermina, as a good wife, is asking for a loan for her husband to use in his business. He has a stall at the market in the city where he sells fruits and vegetables. He works every day from 5:00AM until 2:00PM. He leaves at dawn for the market to buy the best products in order to be able to offer his customers the best which is why he always has many customers. He has been in this business more than 25 years and this is why they never lacked for bread on their table.

This loan is to be used to buy fruits and vegetables. She has been with the communal bank for more than ten cycles and she likes it because thanks to the loans the business has greatly improved. 

Her dreams are of getting ahead and that she and her family members stay healthy.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to be sold by her husband at the stall he has at the market

loans.name: Nancy Biolinda

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Corazón  Mejía.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 42 años de edad, esta viuda pues su querido esposo falleció hace años atrás pero de esa  relación tiene dos hijos de 17 y 10 años los mismos que fueron su consuelo en los momentos difíciles de su vida, ellos  estudian en colegio y escuela.

Doña Nancy con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y una que otra bisutería cuando le encargan sus clientes, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local,   le realizan muchos  pedidos sus clientes ya que siempre trae mercadería seleccionada. Su mercadería la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene más de seis años que se dedica a esta actividad ya que después de que falleció su marido es así como ella saca adelante a sus hijos de una forma honrada.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, sabanas  y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado para salir adelante.
 
Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In Mejía, located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city where people mostly work in agriculture and growing and selling coconuts, the communal bank “Corazón Mejía” meets twice a month.

Nancy lives here. She is 42 years old and is a widow since her dear husband died many years ago. Through this relationship she has two sons who are 17 and 10 years old, and they were her comfort during difficult moments of her life. They are school students.

Nancy, with the intention of earning something on her own and thus being able to get ahead in the household, works in business, selling all types of clothing, sheets, and costume jewelry when her customers place an order for it. She sells from door to door and she also sells at home where she has a small shop. Her customers request many orders and she always brings the selected merchandise. She buys the merchandise by going to Guayaquil, going once or twice a month depending on what she needs. She has more than six years experience in this business as after her husband died she had to bring up her children in an honorable way.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, sheets and costume jewelry. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes the assistance it has given her to get ahead.

Her dream is to see her children complete their education and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, sheets, and costume jewelry for her business

loans.name: Angela Leonor

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Corazón  Mejía.

En este lugar vive la señora Angela, tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y el menor de 15 años, dos de ellos  estudian en colegio y son los que aun viven con ellos. El marido trabaja en una huerta. 

Doña Angela con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y para que a sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas y de ropa interior, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan  sus clientes cuando necesitan algo. Ella deja a crédito y cobra por semanas o en quincenas de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Lleva más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que cuenta con buena clientela.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: sabanas  y ropa interior. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 7 ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para mejorar su negocio.
 
Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In Mejía, located a few kilometers from the city of Portviejo, people who work largely in agriculture and the cultivation and sale of coconuts, meet every two weeks at the communal bank Corazón Mejía (Mejía Heart).

Angela lives here. She is 48 years old and has a common-law partner and four children; three adults and one under the age of 15, two of them are studying in school and are still living with them. Her husband works in an orchard.

Angela, with the intention of earning something on her own and with this loan, can help her husband with the household expenses and have her children not lack for anything. She works in trade, selling sheets and undergarments. She sells door to door and also at her home where customers go when they need something. She sells on credit and in cash, weekly or biweekly, according to how customers wish to pay. She buys her merchandise at Guayaquil every two weeks or monthly according to what she needs. She has been working in this business for ten years and it is going very well as she has a good customer base.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as sheets and undergarments. She has been with the communal bank for 7 cycles and she likes it for the help that loans provide to improve her business.

Her dream is to see her children complete their education and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy sheets and undergarments.

loans.name: Lexi Alexandra

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Corazón  Mejía.

En este lugar vive la señora Lexi, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  10 años que estudia en la escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
 
Ella aprendió belleza en una academia hace varios años atrás y hoy para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera mantener el hogar y los estudios de sus hijo se dedica a realizar trabajos de arreglo personal, ella realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabello, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas,  sus clientes le llaman y ella se traslada a sus casas a realizar su trabajo o si no se acercan hasta su hogar para que les realice lo que ellos desean. Trabaja todos los días, lleva más de 7 años en esta actividad y le gusta lo que hace.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar cepillos de pelo, tijeras, peinillas, tintes, esmaltes y otros productos necesarios en su trabajo. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. 

Su sueño  tener un salón de belleza completo.
texts.en:
In Mejía, located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city where its people is mainly dedicated to agriculture and coconut growth and sale, the communal bank Corazon Mejia meets every fifteen days.  

Mrs. Lexi lives in this place. She is 30 years old, married and has a 10-year-old son from this relationship, who attends schools.  Her husband is a farmer. She learned cosmetology a few years back. Today, in order to earn her own income, help her husband with household expenses and her son’s education expenses, she does personal styling jobs.  

Her jobs vary from hair coloring and manicures among other things. Her clients call her and she goes to their homes to perform her job, or they may come to her house to have something done they desire her to do.  She works everyday. She has been doing this activity for 7 years and she enjoys what she does. 

She will use this loan to buy hairbrushes, scissors, combs, hair coloring dye, nail polish and other necessary products for her job.  This is her third cycle with the communal bank and she likes that the loans are fast and without many requisites.  

Her dream is to open her own full service beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy hair brushes, scissors, combs, hair dye, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem, a widow, sells grocery items and fish in a market of Kompong Speu province, generating a suitable income to apply to her daily consumption, especially for food. She has been operating in this field since 2000. 

She is 47 years old and a loving mother who takes care of eight children. Seven of her children have been married already. None of them are studying, but they are all employed in various kinds of careers.

Chem is now asking for a loan through HKL, a successful microfinance institution, to refill her inventory and purchase fish for her business. Hopefully, Chem’s profit will increase when her store has more customers. 

For her future goal, Chem wishes to expand her store and increase her stock of inventory to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to refill her inventory and purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Pho is 33 years old and a humble villager living in Kompong Speu province. He is married with four dependent children who currently are attending school. Pho’s main income is generated from his professional skills. He is a motor mechanic and provides his services around the province. His wife helps him in generating income by working in a local garment factory as part of the sewing staff. Pho can make extra income with his recent established business - a car and motorcycle wash.

At present, Pho would like to have a loan from Kiva lenders to help him in building a ground floor room made of bricks. He will use the loan to purchase a door along with its frame for the room. Also he will use the remaining funds to enhance his car and motorcycle wash business. 

Pho hopes to have his business as well as his living conditions improved and make more revenue, which he will use for future emergencies and his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a door along with its frame for his new ground floor room.

loans.name: Florelyn Jennifer

texts.en:
Florelyn Jennifer is a degree holder and has three children. She is a single mother who aims to provide her children with a quality education and better way of life. Florelyn Jennifer works at a private school and at the same time she operates her rental carinderia (mini-restaurant) and refreshment stall. Whenever she has finished her class she immediately goes to her stall to help her staff member prepare the viand and other snacks to sell.

Florelyn Jennifer's business location is in front of the private school so she needs to help her staff member in preparing things to be able to have a smooth flow for her business. Aside from carinderia, she also offers home made sweet ham as an additional source of income, because her salary is used for her children's education, allowances, daily needs and other household expenses. Since she is single mother, she needs to double her effort and manage her business wisely to fulfil her dreams in life. 

Florelyn Jennifer would like to ask for additional capital amounting to PHP25,000 to allow her to buy soft drinks, snack foods and frozen foods for her food stall. She believes that her business will become progressive because of her determination and hard work.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks and frozen foods for her food stall

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina has been engaged in her hog raising business for nine years already. She is asking for financial assistance from KIVA lenders to further expand her business. She would like to borrow PHP 15,000 to have additional capital that will be use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She hopes that her loan will be given a chance because it will be a big help in earning more income to provide for her family's needs. Regina is now 54 years old and is married to Federico, who is a farmer. They have two children who are in the adult-aged. The couple lives in the rural village of Santa Isabel in the province of Isabela, where farming is the main source of income for most residents.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is an industrious man who has a flower shop business in their Public Market. As his father left them, he dedicates himself more into their business to maintain its prosperity. 

As a matter of fact, he is requesting additional capital in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy more varieties of flowers.  He dreams of making their business a viable source of income as he promised to his father, so he is doing his best to increase their sales every day. He doesn't want to worry about anything in his business as well as in their living.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of flowers.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has been dreaming of alleviating her poor living conditions someday. She is married to Ceser, who works as a farmer in their village. They have four children. Clarito and Arlene are both married. Armie, her third child, is now in Manila working as a maid. Their youngest is seventeen years old, and has finished studying. Her family lives in the village of Santa Isabel in the province of Isabela. 

Anita has been working in her hog-raising business for years. For daily income, she also sells vegetables to their entire village. She retails her vegetable products, which she purchases from the town market. 

She hopes to gain more profit from both of her businesses to able to provide the primary needs of her family. Anita is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to have capital to purchase a supply of feed for her hogs, along with vegetables and other commodities that she may add to her product line. 

She believes the loan is the best way to make her businesses more productive. By growing her businesses, she believes that their way of living will somehow be uplifted.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of feed for her hogs, as well as vegetables and other commodities that she may add to her product line.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 48-year-old woman with three school-aged children from the village of Santa Isabel in the province of Isabela. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for 32 years. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed for her hogs, and piglets, so she can get additional income to provide for the needs of her family. 

In the future, Vilma hopes that she can expand her business and renovate their house.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs, along with piglets for her business.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 from KIVA lenders for additional capital for her livestock business (pig raising). She is planning to purchase  piglets to grow her business, and also to buy feed for the livestock's food needs. 

She lacks the capital now, so she is hoping for lenders to give her financial assistance. The loan she is asking for will be a big help, and help her business grow. She hopes that she will be given a chance to grow her business so she can provide for the education of her youngest child. She hopes to give him a bright future, and she believes her business will be of great help. 

Avelina is 52 years old. She lives with her family in the rural village of Sta. Isabela, in the province of Isabela. They live simply. Their major source of income is through the farm that was formerly managed by her husband, who has passed away. Four of her eldest children are already living independently. 

Avelina is hoping that through her requested loan, she will be able to uplift her family's current poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en:
Srey Pov (who is in the picture with her son) is 31 years old. She is married, and lives with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than 10 years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals. She earns approximately $2 per day. 

Her husband runs a public transportation service (Tuk Tuk). He earns about $20 each day. Because the existing Tuk Tuk trailer is old, Srey Pov is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a new Tuk Tuk trailer for her husband to run the service. This purchase will help him obtain a new vehicle, and attract more customers. 

In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home, and send her children to a good school. She hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new Tuk Tuk trailer for her husband to run his taxi service.

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie, 43, is married and lives in the village of Santa Isabel, province of Isabela. Her farming business provides for her family. She is a hardworking mother and she makes sure she can meet the daily needs of her family. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pig. 

In the future, Lailanie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her farming business.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte, in the province of Isabela. She is 32 years old and married with four school-aged children. 

Prima raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has had this business for over 3 years, and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. 

Prima is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000, which she will use to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Moth

texts.en:
Moth is a 26-year-old married man who is responsible for two school-aged children. He and his family live in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. Moth is an independent entrepreneur whose job is to produce and sell charcoal. He also does farming in the rainy season. Moth usually makes approximately $2 US per day from each business.

To help in his farming business, Moth would like to take out a loan to purchase cows to maintain the rice field. They would also be raised for offspring. Moth hopes that his living conditions will improve and that he can afford to send his children to a higher level of education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cows to maintain the rice field

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem, aged 43, is a humble farmer and a responsible mother of one child. She lives in Kompong Speu province. Sem is an industrious farmer, working full time at the rice field, earning $2 US per day to add to her husband’s income. Sem’s husband is involved in the business of fishing and selling fish.

Sem is taking out a loan because she needs additional funds to have her house completely repaired. She will use the loan to pay for labor costs and to purchase building materials needed for the construction. She hopes to have a suitable house for her family and provide them with good living conditions. In the future, Sem wishes to have additional pieces of farmland for better yields and to increase her income to meets the family's living needs.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and to purchase building materials needed for the construction.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 36 years old and a very responsible mother of two school-aged children. She is married to Jose from Sta. Isabel province of Isabela. 

Raquel is engaged in selling a variety of products to the people of their village. She is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy more products such as spices, snack foods, and drinks for her business. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy products such as spices, snack foods, and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en: Savorn, 35 years old, is married and lives with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. For more than three years, she has been running a business which has acquired the exclusive right to provide already-mixed concrete. Savorn earns approximately $50 daily and her husband helps her run the business. Due to lack of funds, Savorn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay her workers' salaries. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to pay her workers' salaries

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa, 45 years old, is from the village of Santa Isabel Norte, in the province of Isabela. She is married to Ronilo, who works hard on their own farm. The couple has four children.

Narcisa has been selling vinegar and soy sauce in their village. She purchases these items in huge containers and retails them in small bottles. Narcisa generates a net income of PHP 5,000 monthly from her business, which is of great help in providing for the family's needs. Narcisa is planning to re-open her general store but she has insufficient capital to purchase various commodities. She is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to be used as additional starting capital for her retail business. She hopes that, with the help of lenders, she will be able to pursue her retail business to provide a better living for her family. She hopes that her loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy products such as canned goods, spices and beverages for her store

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Teresa is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. She is 50 years old. Teresa is married and has 7 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Teresa owns and operates a retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling juice and vinegar to local businesses and community members. 

Teresa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products like vinegar, soy sauce, and spices.

loans.name: Learnie

texts.en:
Learnie is 35 years old and married with four grown children. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for 3 years. 

Learnie is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy feed and additional piglets for her hog raising business in order to earn additional income to support the needs of her family. Learnie hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, 48, is a hardworking person who is raising children and operating a livestock business, with chickens, ducks and pigs. Lolita is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy vitamins and feed for her livestock. Lolita hopes that someday her business will expand to meet all of her family's needs and to enable her to renovate their house to have good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her livestock

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida, a very hardworking mother of four, is married to Romeo. They live in the village of Santa Isabel province of Isabela. 

Adelaida dreams that someday she can renovate their house and all her children can finish their studies. In that matter, Adelaida is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and piglets for her hog raising business so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets for her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 40-year-old businesswoman who lives with her husband and two children in the village of Santa Isabel Norte. She has been involved in a hog raising business and it has been her main source of income since she got married. 

Nenita would like to improve and grow her hog-raising business and hopefully she will be able to obtain the loan she has requested. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to be used in purchasing feed for her grown-up pigs and to purchase additional piglets to raise. She also aims to obtain the education she needs to be able to acquire better opportunities in life someday.

Nenita hopes that her husband will always be patient in working on their farm so that they will be able to help each other in attaining their aspirations.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a mother who wishes for a bright future for her children. She is 42 years old and has a total of seven children. She is married to Alfredo, who manages their farm lot, which is located in their village of Santa Isabela Norte. Among their seven children, three are now in school. Visitacion hopes to provide for all of her children so they can finish their studies. She hopes that someday her children will live better and more comfortable lives compared to the poor status of living they are experiencing at the moment. 

Visitacion is involved in managing a hog-raising business. She hopes that her livestock business will improve with the help of Kiva lenders who are willing to lend to her. She wants to request 11,000 PHP to use as added business capital to secure a feed supply for the pigs she is raising. She believes that seeking the help of lenders is one way to make her business grow and help her become a success in life.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 58-year-old client who lives with her husband and four children in their own house in Manaring, Ilagan, Isabela. Leonida lives in the rural part of this area with only electricity service. Leonida is eager to raise her family and give them a better quality of life. Leonida works daily, selling different products in her store. She has many customers because she is very approachable. Leonida also raises poultry which she sells to the people of her village and in the local market. 

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase different products such as fish, vinegar, soy sauce, coffee, bread, noodles and canned goods to sell. This loan will allow her to continue to develop her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish, vinegar, soy sauce, coffee, bread, noodles and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Jingle

texts.en:
