loans.use: buy farming raw materials (carrots, cabbages, onions, watering can and others) to increase her production.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos todos frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É comerciante e dona do seu negocio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (massas, arroz, farinha, sabão, ovos, leite  e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 

No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é concluir a sua obra e adquirir fundos para poder realizar o seu desejo.
texts.en:
Teresa is married and the mother of 4 children who all attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a trader and owns her own business selling various products. With this loan she plans to buy products (pasta, rice, flour, soap, eggs, milk and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future Teresa wishes to complete her house to improve the comfort of her family. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to complete the building work on her home and acquire funds to carry out her wish.

loans.use: buy products (pasta, rice, flour, soap, eggs, milk and others) to increase the quantity of her stock

loans.name: Roide

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho que frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É militar no Ministério da Defesa Nacional e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção  (cimento, Varrão de ferro, loiça sanitária e outros) para ampliar a sua casa. 

No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e progredir na sua carreira, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é realizar os seus sonhos e sustentar outros familiares que estão na Província de Manica.
texts.en:
Roide is married and the father of 1 son who attends School. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He is part of the military for the Ministry of National Defense and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (cement, iron rod, bathroom porcelain and others) to expand his house.

In future Roide hopes to complete his house and progress in his career. To this end, he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to make his dreams come true and support his other family members who are in the Manica Province.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, iron rod, bathroom porcelain and others) to expand his house

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho ainda menor de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É docente e do quadro do Ministério da Educação e possui um negocio de venda de carne de vaca. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar uma balança electrónica e carne para revenda.

No futuro deseja progredir no seu negocio criando algumas espécies animais para abater e vender, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para puder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é a falta de um meio circulante para puder transportar a sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Antonio is married and the father of 1 son who is still under age, lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a teacher, a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education and  owns a business selling cow meat. With this loan he plans to buy a set of electronic scales and meat for resale.

In future Antonio hopes to progress his business by rearing some species of animals to slaughter and sell. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to access further financing from Hluvuku.

His challenge is the adequate road conditions to transport his goods.

loans.use: buy a set of electronic scales and meat for resale.

loans.name: Uzinduzi Group

texts.en:
Amesa, who is in her late 20s, is single with two girls who still go to school. She has been a food vendor for six years now. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more food items (some kilos of rice, sacks of charcoal, maize flour and liters of Kerosine) and she has paid back all her loan successfully. She request this loan to buy more stocks of food items to make more food to resell to more customers. Her dream is to one day be able to build a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group " Uzinduzi" which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food items.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: Carlos tiene 28 años de edad es casado tiene 3 hijos. El comenzó en su negocio de chifleria desde hace 7 años atrás fue cuando su padre le enseño este trabajo que él decidió  comenzar a independizarse y fue con la ayuda de su esposa que dieron la apertura a las ventas de chifles. Actualmente trabaja junto a su esposa de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Con el crédito quiere comprar plátanos  y adecuar su local
texts.en: Carlos is a 28 year old married man, father of three children.   He started his plantain chip business seven years ago, after his father taught him how to do this type of work. Carlos decided to start his business with the help of his wife so they opened a plantain chip shop. Currently, he works with his wife Monday through Friday from 8 am to 5 pm. With this credit he will purchase plantains and make adaptations to his shop.

loans.use: to purchase plantains and make adaptations to his shop.

loans.name: Zoila Maritza

texts.es: Maritza  vive en la ciudad de Manta de la provincia de Manabí tiene  46 años de edad es divorciada tiene 2 hijos que estudian en una escuela pública cerca de su casa. Ella comenzó su negocio de costura   como un hobbies cuando le hizo disfraz para un evento a su hija en su escuela y con el pasar del tiempo ese hobbies se convirtió en su trabajo. En la actualidad ella confecciona disfraces, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes de 3 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche. Con el crédito comprara telas, hilos e implementos para disfraces etc.
texts.en:
Maritza lives in the city of Manta in the Manabí province.  She is 46 years old, divorced, and has 2 children who study at a public school near her house.

She began her sewing business as a hobby when she made her daughter a costume for a school event.  With the passage of time, her hobby turned into her work.  She currently makes costumes and works from Monday to Friday, from 3 in the afternoon to 8 at night.  With the loan, she will buy fabric, thread and tools for costumes, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and tools for costumes, etc.

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Hassan, who is in his late 30s, is married and has two children who attend school. He has been running a business selling secondhand clothes for two years. Hassan works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Hassan is requesting his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He has repaid all of his previous loans, which he used to buy a plot of land, to start building his family house, to increase his business stock and to cover household expenses. Hassan will use this new loan to increase his inventory of secondhand clothes to resell to more customers. His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house and to expand his business in more places.

Hassan will share this loan with his group " Crane" which consists of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of secondhand clothes to resell to more customers.

loans.name: Segundo Rafael

texts.es: Segundo vive en la ciudad de Manta de la provincia de Manabí. El tiene 29 años de edad  es casado tiene 2 hijos que asisten a una escuela cerca de su casa. El comenzó el trabajo de herrería a causa de que era un negocio familiar ya que su padre fue el que le enseño la labor. Realmente el tiene 4 años de haber independizado con el negocio propio de herrería. El trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Con el préstamo quiere comprar caladora, pinzas, materiales etc. Su meta es tener ampliar su negocio y poder enseñarles a muchas personas este trabajo
texts.en: Segundo lives in the city of Manta, Manabí Province. He is 29 years old, married, and has two children to attend a school near his home. He started working as a blacksmith because it was a family business and it was his father who taught him the trade. He has been independent, with his own blacksmith shop, for four years. He works Monday to Friday from eight in the morning until six in the evening. With the loan, he wants to buy a jigsaw, pliers, materials, etc. His goal is to expand his business and be able to teach the trade to many people.

loans.use: to buy a jigsaw, pliers, materials, etc.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасул  молодой семьянин,недавно переехал в другой дом от родителей.   Женат  и имеет  детей.  В этом новом доме    у него много бытовых расходов по строительству.  Сам Абдурасул работает в  сотовой компании программистом  и больше не имеет дополнительных доходов, поэтому решил получить кредит, чтобы покрыть свою крышу от дождей и морозов.   Из своей зарплаты он не  может накопить деньги. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и   надеется каждый раз получать кредит и за счет кредита сделать много работы в своем новом доме. На полученный кредит планирует купить строительные материалы для покрытия крыши.
texts.en: Abdurasul is a young family man who has recently moved out of his parents' house and into a separate one. He is married and has children. In his new home, he has many household expenses related to construction. Abdurasul himself works as a programmer for a mobile phone company, and does not have any other supplementary income. For this reason, he has decided to take out a loan so he can cover his roof from the rain and cold. He cannot save up enough money from his salary, so he has come to Arvand in the hopes of receiving a loan that will allow him to do a lot of work on his new house. Abdurasul plans to use the loan to buy building materials to cover the roof.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Karla Gisela

texts.es: Karla vive en la ciudad de La Libertad provincia de Santa Elena es madre soltera tiene 1 hija de 1 mes de nacida ella. Con la ayuda de su madre Karla dio la apertura a un cibercafé, aprovechando que Karla sabe bastante de computadoras su madre la ayudo a abrir el cibercafé. Ella trabaja junto a su madre de lunes a sábado desde la 8 e la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Con el préstamo quiere comprar computadoras, mouse, arreglar el local etc. Su meta es implementar más computadoras para así dar un mejor servicio a su clientela
texts.en: Karla lives in the city of La Libertad within the province of Santa Elena. She is a single mother with a one-month old daughter. With her mother’s help, Karla opened a cybercafé. Given that Karla knows a lot about computers; her mother helped her to open the cybercafé. She works with her mother every Monday to Saturday from 8:00AM to 10:00PM. The loan will be used to buy computers, mice, improve the locale, etc. Her goal is to set up more computers to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy computers, mice, improve the locale, etc.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María vive en el Suburbio  de la ciudad de  Guayaquil. Ella tiene 37 años  es divorciada no tiene hijos. María  a falta de que no conseguía un trabajo estable hace 10 años. Tomo la decisión  de ponerse un negocio propio  ya que María tiene habilidades para cocinar  abrió  un comedor  en su casa pues ahí vende comida. Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6:00am hasta 21:00pm. Con el préstamo ella  quiere comprar arroz, aceite y también  arreglar el local etc. Su meta a futuro es comprarse una camioneta para poder realizar su entrega de comida  a lugares lejanos, y  también que su comedor se convierta en un restaurante muy reconocido por vender comidas típicas del Ecuador.
texts.en:
María lives in the Suburb of the city of Guayaquil.  She is 37 years old, divorced, and has no children.  Ten years ago, María was unable to find a stable job.  She decided to start her own business, and since she has a talent for cooking, she opened a canteen at her house, where she sells food.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 6:00am to 9:00pm.  

With the loan, she wants to buy rice and oil, and also to fix up the premises, etc.  Her future goal is to buy herself a station wagon so that she can deliver food to remote locations, and also to convert her canteen to a restaurant that is well-known for selling typical Ecuadorian foods.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil, and also to fix up the premises, etc.

loans.name: Catalina Agripina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 60 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad por lo que son independientes. Comenzó su taller de elaboraciones de calzado hace ya 8 años atrás con la ayuda de su esposa elaboran zapatillas y luego las venden. Una de las mayores dificultades es la forma de transportar su calzados por tiene que alquilar una camioneta. Con el crédito comprara cuero, suelas,  hebillas, gomas etc. Su meta es comprarse una camioneta para así transportar su calzados a diferentes lugares.
texts.en: Catalina, 60, is married and has three adult children who are now independent.  She started her shoe-making workshop 8 years ago with her husband’s help; they manufacture sandals they then sell.  One of her greatest difficulties is transporting the footwear because they have to hire a pick-up truck to do so.  She will use the loan to buy leather, soles, buckles, glue, etc.  Her goal is to buy a pick-up truck to transport her footwear to different places.

loans.use: to buy leather, soles, buckles, glue, etc.

loans.name: Khory Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KHORY”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de regalos, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de  artículos varios, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa, venta de llantas,  venta de útiles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Elena es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora que trabaja en la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio producción y venta de charquecan (comida tradicional de Bolivia); cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace años, siendo ayudante de comida, posteriormente son un pequeño capital que tuvo inicio su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mote, charque, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales del altiplano y posteriormente a la elaboración comercializará sus platos en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella está casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “KHORY” will start its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer [MFI], as part of the Focal Center of Patacamaya. The group has eight members and a governing board headed by María Elena. The members of the communal bank carry out different business activities, such as: selling gifts, food, various articles, beverages, clothing, tires, and supplies.
The requested loan will benefit microentrepeneurs like María Elena. She points out that this would be her second loan with Pro Mujer. She joined following an invitation from an MFI promoter that visited her house. Currently, she has a business producing and selling “charquecan” [traditional Bolivian dish]. She learned how to do this a long time ago working as a food assistant. Afterwards, she started her own business with a small amount of capital.
The loan will be used to increase her capital (buying maize, jerky, etc.) by acquiring it through the traditional fairs of the Bolivian altiplano. She will then prepare her dishes and sell them from her food stall. Her work has allowed her to earn an income to support her household since she is married and has three children.
When asked what she likes the most about Pro Mujer [MFI], she responds that she likes the health and credit programs.

loans.use: to buy maize, jerky, etc.

loans.name: Ketty Leticia

texts.es: Ketty  vive en Duran de la provincia del Guayas. Es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella comenzó desde muy temprana edad cuando su madre le enseño la actividad de estilista. Actualmente ella tiene un gabinete de belleza dentro de su vivienda. Ella trabaja con una amiga haciendo planchado de cabello, tinturado de cabello desde  lunes a sábados de 8 de la mañana hasta 8 de la noche. Con el préstamo quiere comprar secadora, plancha de cabello, tintes etc.
texts.en: Ketty lives in Duran in Guayas Province.  She’s single and has no children.  She started very young when her mother taught her hair styling.  She currently has a hair styling station at home.  She works with a girlfriend doing hair straightening and hair coloring Monday through Saturday from 8am until 8pm.  She wants to use the loan to buy a hair dryer, a hair straightening comb, hair color, etc.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, a hair straightening comb, hair color, etc.

loans.name: Hunsuhon Christian Georges

texts.fr:
Mr  HUNSUHON CHRISTIAN GEORGES  est célibataire sans enfant.

Il est étudiant en classe de licence III professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  3ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.

Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.

Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle.  Il envisage après les  études  travailler et se marier.
texts.en:
Hunsuhon Christian Georges is single, and has no children. He is a student in his third year of a professional degree program at the ESTPO (the Ouagadougou University of Public Works), and has been on this course for three years. He is studying here because the ESTPO is a leading school in the field of civil engineering studies in the country. He wants to finance his higher education studies.

Hunsuhon Christian Georges carries out practical work experience placements during the holidays, because he wants to gain professional experience. After his studies he plans to work and get married.

loans.use: to finance his higher education studies.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa, tiene 28 años de matrimonio y ha procreado cuatro hijos. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, uno de sus hijos vive en el extranjero y aporta para los gastos del hogar. Ella manifiesta que aprendió de su madre que la familia es lo principal, por eso se dedica a ellos; también se dedica al cuidado de gallinas y cerdos. 

El préstamo será invertido para comprar cerámica, separadores de cerámica, hierro para preparar el suelo para pegar la cerámica. Con la inversión mejorara su vivienda, ya que cuando sus hijos estaban pequeños no tenía la oportunidad de realizarlo y ahora que su hijo le apoya y Fundación Campo también lo desea hacer. Además que con la venta de gallinas y cerdos obtiene otro ingreso. Ella desea continuar trabajando con la Fundación y con los amigos de KIVA.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  She spends her time managing her house.  She has been married for 28 years and has borne four children.  Her husband makes his living in agriculture, and one of her sons lives abroad and helps with household expenses.

She says that she learned from her mother that the family comes first, and that is why she focuses on them. She also spends her time raising hens and pigs.  

The loan will be used to buy ceramic tiles, tile separators, and iron to prepare the floor to stick the tiles.  With the investment, she will improve her housing, since she was unable to do so when her children were young.  Now that her son and Fundación Campo are supporting her, she wishes to do it.  She also receives other income from the sale of hens and pigs.  She wants to continue working with the Fundación and with the friends of KIVA.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles, tile separators, and iron to prepare the floor to stick the tiles.

loans.name: Ana Pastora

texts.es: Ana vive en ciudad de Duran de la provincia del  Guayas. Es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en un colegio público cerca del sector. En su casa tiene 2 lavadoras y fue que un día una vecina le dijo que le alquilara  una lavadora y fue como vio Ana que el negocio resultaba y compro 3 lavadoras más. En la actualidad ella alquila lavadoras por lo día a día aumenta. El sueño de Ana es tener un local propio para convertirlo en una lavandería de primer nivel. Con el préstamo comprara detergentes, lavadoras y dara mantenimientos a las lavadora que ya tiene etc.
texts.en: Ana lives in the city of Duran, which is in the Guayas province. She is married and has 2 children who are studying at a nearby public school. She had 2 washing machines in her house and one day a neighbour asked if she could rent one of them. Ana realised that she could have a business and she bought 3 more washing machines. Now she rents out her washing machines. The business is growing every day. Ana's dream is have her own premises and to convert it into a first class laundry. With this loan she will buy detergents and washing machines and service the washing machines she already has, etc.

loans.use: to buy detergents and washing machines, and to service the washing machines she has already

loans.name: Liz Esperanza

texts.es: Liz tiene 54 años d edad  es divorciada tiene hijos mayores de edad por lo que no viven con ella ya que son  independientes. Ella siempre quiso tener su propio negocio y fue gracia al primer préstamo  que pudo abrir su local de venta de accesorios de celular. En la actualidad ella vende carcasas estuches de celular. El trabajo lo realiza solo de lunes a viernes a sábados de 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Con el préstamo quiere  comprar celulares, cargadores, auriculares etc. Su meta es ser una distribuidora de accesorios de celulares
texts.en: Liz is 54 years old and divorced. She has older children who no longer live with her since they are independent. She always wanted to have her own business. Thanks to her first loan she was able to open a business selling cell phone accessories. Currently she sells cell phone cases. She works Monday to Saturday from eight in the morning until ten in the evening. With this loan, she wants to purchase cell phones, charges, handsets, etc. Her goal is to be a cellphone accessory distributor.

loans.use: purchase cell phones, chargers, handsets, etc.

loans.name: Henry Milagro

texts.es: Henry tiene 34 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijos que asisten a  una escuela pública cerca de su casa. Su padre le enseño el trabajo  familiar que era la fabricación de sandalias y zapatillas. El comenzó a independizarse en su negocio de confeccion de calzados  hace 7 años atrás. En la actualidad trabaja junto a su esposa todos los días de 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Con el crédito comprara cuero, plantillas,  ormas, goma amarilla etc. Su meta es ampliar su negocio para así poder enseñar este trabajo muchas personas más y así poder brindar trabajo a gente lo necesite
texts.en: Henry, 34, is married and has two children who attend a nearby public school. His father taught him the family trade, making sandals and sneakers. Seven years ago, he started his own business making footwear. He and his wife now work together seven days a week from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. He will use the loan to buy leather, insoles, lasts, yellow glue, and more. His goal is to expand his business so that he can teach the trade to others and provide jobs.

loans.use: to buy leather, insoles, lasts, yellow glue, and more.

loans.name: Reyna Maribel

texts.es: Reyna tiene  32 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo de 12 años que estudia en  un colegio público de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Reyna a falta de un trabajo estable hace 10 años, toma la decisión  de ponerse un negocio propio  ya que María tiene habilidades para cocinar  abrió  un comedor  en su casa pues  vende comida. En la actualidad ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6:00am hasta 21:00pm. Con el préstamo ella  quiere comprar arroz, aceite y también  arreglar el local etc. Su meta a futuro es comprarse una camioneta para poder realizar su entrega de comida  a lugares lejanos, y  también que su comedor se convierta en un restaurante muy reconocido por vender comidas típicas del Ecuador.
texts.en: Reyna is 32 years old. She is a single mother. She has a 12 year old son who studies at a public high school in the city of Guayaquil. Reyna had not had a a stable job ten years ago. She decided to start her own business since she has cooking skills. She opened a canteen in her home selling food. Currently, she works from Monday to Friday from six in the morning until nine in the evening. With this loan, she wants to purchase rice, oil, and to also repair the business location. Her dream for the future is to purchase a van in order to deliver food orders to faraway places. She also has a goal of converting her canteen into a well-known restaurant that sells typical foods from Ecuador.

loans.use: purchase rice, oil and repair the business location.

loans.name: Joaquín Chicas

texts.es:
Don Joaquín tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Desde hace un año él se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ganado. Antes se dedicaba a las labores agrícolas; lo que lo impulso a dedicarse al negocio de compra y venta de ganado fue para demostrarle a su padre que podía hacer algo mejor. Para comprar el ganado, él se traslada a diferentes cantones y caseríos caminando a pie varios kilómetros de terrenos rústicos en busca de realizar un buen negocio, debido a que en los lugares en donde se mueve no hay transporte solo por medio de bestias y mulas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ganado y posteriormente venderlo, ya que actualmente solo dispone de $600 dólares que recibió por la venta de su caballo y necesita más para ampliar su negocio. Por que necesita obtener ganancias, para mantener a su hijo de seis meses y a su esposa. Actualmente, posee una vivienda que no esta en buenas condiciones, porque es muy pequeña y allí mismo almacena los insumos para el cuido del ganado y su deseo es construir una casa con sus respectivas divisiones para que su familia este cómoda.
texts.en:
Joaquín is 32 years old, married, and has one child. He has been buying and selling cattle for one year. Before, he used to work in agriculture. He went into this business to show his father a better way of life. To purchase cattle, he travels by foot to different cantons and neighborhoods walking many kilometers through rural lands to find a good deal given that there is no transportation to these areas, except by animals and mules. 

The loan requested to Fundación Campo [MFI] is to buy cattle for resale, since he only has $600 dollars from the sale of his horse and he needs more to expand his business. With the increased earnings, he can support his six-month old son and wife. Currently, he has a house that is not in very good condition because it is very small and serves as storage space for the inputs required to care for the cattle. He wants to build a house with the proper divisions so that his family is more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale, since he only has $600 dollars from the sale of his horse and he needs more to expand his business.

loans.name: Alejandro Bernardo

texts.es: Alejandro vive en la ciudad La Libertad de la provincia de Santa Elena.  Tiene 34 años de edad  es soltero y no tiene hijos. Él desde muy temprana edad  trabajo como ayudante para un vecino que arreglaba aparatos eléctricos y esa profesión le gusto mucho a Alejandro por eso el quería independizarse. En la actualidad Alejandro se independizo  y tiene su taller de aparatos eléctricos, el repara lavadora, cocina, aire acondicionado etc. Alejandro trabaja de lunes a sábados dese las  8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Con el crédito comprara cilindro de gas para poner a funcionar  su comprensor, herramienta y arreglar su local etc.
texts.en:
Alejandro lives in the city of La Libertad in Santa Elena Province. He is 34, single and has no children. At a very young age he started working as an assistant to a neighbor who fixed electrical equipment. Alejandro really liked this profession and he decided to start working for himself. 

Currently Alejandro works for himself and he has an electrical appliance shop. He fixes washing machines, stoves, air conditioners etc. He works from Monday to Saturday from 8AM to 7PM. 

With this loan he will buy gas cylinders to fix his compressor, tools, fix up his workshop etc.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders to fix his compressor, tools, fix up his workshop etc.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yaneth tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Fue su padre quien le enseño desde los 10 años de edad y ahora que se caso le ayuda a su esposo. Ellos siembran 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 21,000 metros cuadrados de fríjol. Ellos se levantan muy temprano para elaborar el desayuno, luego lleva su hijo a donde su mamá para que lo cuide y ellos se van a trabajar.  En esta cosecha ella no ha podido ayudarle a su esposo, por que esta embarazada. Para comprar los insumos, caminan unos diez minutos para abordar el autobús, este tarda unos cuarenta y cinco minutos para llegar a su destino. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para recolectar su cosecha y para comprar una vaca; pues después de la cosecha queda el rastrojo y con las vacas ellas se lo comerán. Su deseo, es trabajar junto con su esposo, para ahorrar y construir su propia vivienda, ya que en donde viven no es de ellos sino de una hermana de Yaneth y preparar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 32 years old. She is married and has a son. She and her husband work in agriculture. It was her father who taught her from the age of 10, and now that she is married, she helps her husband. They plant 21,000 square meters of corn and 21,000 square meters of beans. They get up very early to prepare breakfast, then they take their son to her mother's so that she can care for him, and they go to work. In this harvest she has not been able to help her husband because she is pregnant. To purchase their supplies, they walk about 10 minutes to catch a bus, which takes some 45 minutes to arrive at their destination.

The loan that she is applying for with Fundación Campo is to harvest their crops and to buy a cow, since after the harvest the stubble will remain and the cows will eat it. Her wish is to work together with her husband to save and build their own house, since the place where they live is not theirs but belongs to one of Yaneth's sisters, and to prepare their children.

loans.use: to harvest her crops and buy a cow

loans.name: Enma Analuz

texts.es: Enma vive en el Fortín  zona norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil, tiene 44 años de edad es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos que son mayores de edad por lo que ya son independientes. Ella a raíz de la separación de su ex pareja toma la decisión de buscar trabajo y como nadie le dada la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa,Entonces´penso en abrir un local propio y  fue como comenzo ahorrar dinero tiempo despues el sueño de Enma se hizo realidad porque dio la apertura a su negocio propio la cual  es una tienda de víveres en general. En la actualidad trabaja en su tienda de víveres todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Con el préstamo comprara  arroz, azúcar harina, vitrinas  y arreglara su local, etc. Su meta es tener un mini market reconocido en la ciudad para satisfacer las necesidades de los consumidores
texts.en: Enma lives in Fortín, in the northern zone of the city of Guayaquil. She is 44 years old, divorced and has three grown children who are independent. When she separated from her ex-husband, she made the decision to look for work. Because nobody would give her the opportunity to work at a company, she then thought to open her own store. She started to save money and a while later, Enma's dream became a reality when she opened her own general store. Currently, she works in her store every day from 8 in the morning until 10 at night. With this loan, she will fix up her store and buy rice, sugar, flour, display cases, etc. Her goal is to have a mini market that is known throughout the city for satisfying its customers' needs.

loans.use: to fix up her store and buy rice, sugar, flour and display cases

loans.name: Gabriela Josefina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Gabriela, tiene 25 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene dos hijos de  7 y 6 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela.
 
La señora Gabriela con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante sola con sus hijos se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, ella aprovecha para salir todas las mañanas ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil una vez al mes o de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, gracias a esto saca sola adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  4 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.  

Su sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Pedregal" meets every fifteen days in the El Pedregal community, in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for being an active commercial zone, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the cheerfulness of its people. 

In this place lives Gabriela, who is 25 years old. She is separated, but from this relationship she has two children, 7 and 6 years old, who are both in school. 

With the intention of earning something on her own, and thus being able to get ahead alone with her children, Gabriela dedicates herself to commerce, selling clothing of all types. Her method of selling is from door to door, and she also sells from her home where she has a small shop. She takes advantage of the opportunity to go out every morning, since at this time her children are in school. She sells to her customes on credit and collects payments every fifteen days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise once a month or according to her needs. She has dedicated herself to this work for 5 years, and it is going very well for her. Thanks to this she is successfully supporting her children alone. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank for 4 years, and she likes it because of the help it provides to her with the loans. 

Her dream is that her children will not lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Inés Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Inés, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 18, 5 y 2 años, los dos mayores  estudian en universidad y  escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella junto al esposo tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas  y ciertas carnes y embutidos, trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo también les ayuda cuando puede y está desocupado, ellos tienen más de 10 años con este negocio el cual les da lo necesario para vivir y  poco a poco han ido aumentado con el pasar de los días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos han comprado nuevos productos que le han ayudado a mejorar su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The El Pedregal Communal Bank meets every 15 days in El Pedregal, in Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. It is a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for its joyful people. 

This is where Inés lives. She is 39 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has three children, ages 18, 5 and 2 years old. Her two older children are studying in university and school, respectively. Her husband is a merchant.

Together with her husband, Inés has a grocery store in her house. She sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables, fruits, and certain meats and sausages. They work every day from 6:00 AM until 8:00 PM and sometimes later. Their son also helps them when he is not busy and is able to. They have had this business for over ten years and it provides what they need to live. Little by little, it has been growing as the days pass.

This loan will be used to better stock Inés' store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other staple products. Inés as been in the communal bank for four cycles now and she likes it because, with the loans, she has bought new products that have helped improve her business.

Her goals are to continue moving her business forward and for it to grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other staple goods

loans.name: Cruz Liliana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 13 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio,  los tres menores aun vive con ella. Su esposo es albañil.

La señora Cruz con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar  se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual sale tres días de la semana, deja a crédito  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil una vez al mes o de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y lo que más vende es ropa interior de damas.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa interior de damas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  4 años y le gusta porque  los créditos le ayudan a financiar su negocio.
 
Sus sueños es ver que  sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenas personas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Pedregal" meets every fifteen days in the El Pedregal community, in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for being an active commercial zone, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the cheerfulness of its people.

In this place lives Cruz, who is 42 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has four children, two who are adults and two aged 17 and 13, who are both in school. The three younger ones still live with her. Her husband is a mason. 

With the intention of earning something on her own, and thus helping her husband with the household expenses, Cruz dedicates herself to commerce, selling clothing of all types. Her method of selling is from door to door, and she goes out three days a week. She sells to her customes on credit and collects payments every 8 days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise once a month or according to her needs. She has dedicated herself to this work for 3 years, and what she sells the most is women's underwear. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and women's underwear. She has been in the communal bank for 4 years, and she likes it because the loans help her to finance her business. 

Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and be good people.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and women's underwear to sell.

loans.name: Naila Josefina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Naila, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 10 y 3 años, los mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es obrero.
 
Doña Naila es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que el no gana mucho en su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día ya sea en la mañana o en la tarde sin un horario fijo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Pedregal" meets every fifteen days in the El Pedregal community, in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for being an active commercial zone, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the cheerfulness of its people.

In this place lives Naila, who is 32 years old. She has a common-law husband with whom she has three children, aged 11, 10 and 3. The older ones are in school. Her husband is a laborer. 

Naila is a housewife, and in order to obtain her own resources and thus help her husband with the household expenses, since he does not earn much from his work, she dedicates herself to selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works three days a week, from two to three hours a day, either in the morning or the evening, without fixed working hours. She sells her products on credit and collects payments every eight days. She has dedicated herself to this work for three years, and it is going very well for her. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry. This is her third loan cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. 

Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Nancy Imelda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 12, 7 años y un bebé de tres meses de edad, los mayores  estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Doña Nancy como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, el cual tiene un puesto en el mercado  de la ciudad en el que vende frutas y verduras. Trabaja todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 14h00, su esposo se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes lo mejor, lleva más de 10  años con este negocio con el cual el saca adelante a su familia honradamente.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar frutas y verduras. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque de esta forma ella puede ayudara a su esposo.
  
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres en el mercado.
texts.en:
The “El Pedregal” communal bank meets every two weeks in El Pedregal in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.  Nancy, 30, lives here.  She’s in a free union and has three children who are 12 and 7 years old and a three-month-old baby; the older children attend middle and elementary school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

Nancy, like a good wife, is taking out the loan so her husband can use it in his business.  He has a stand in the city market where he sells fruit and vegetables.  He works every day from 5am until 2pm.  Her husband heads out at dawn to the wholesale market to buy the best products to offer his customers the best.  He’s been in business ten years and is able to support his family by means of this honest work.

The loan will be used to buy fruit and vegetables.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because she’s able to help her husband this way.  Her dream is to have a grocery store in the market.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y  5 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. El marido es jardinero.
 
Doña María con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, perfumes y bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ya que ella sale tres días de la semana y también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas para exhibir su mercadería, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil y en varias ocasiones a Huaquillas y Colombia. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y tiene mucha clientela que siempre le compran ya que lleva mercadería de primera.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, perfumes y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 años y le gusta porque con los créditos puede comprar más barato lo cual le deja mejores ganancias. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Pedregal" meets every 15 days in the site of El Pedregal in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivities, and for the happiness of its people.

Maria lives in this place.  She is 30 years old, and is in a common-law marriage that has produced 3 children, aged 14, 12 and 5.  The oldest two children are in secondary school, and the youngest attends elementary school.  Maria's husband is a gardener.

In order to earn something on her own, and thereby help her husband with the household expenses, Maria works in retail.  She sells all types of clothing, perfumes and accessories.  She sells door-to-door 3 days a week, and she also sells from her home where she has some glass display cases to exhibit her merchandise.  Maria sells on credit, and collects every 8 days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise, and also occasionally to Huaquillas and Colombia.  She's had this business for 8 years, and she has a lot of customers who always buy from her, because she carries top quality merchandise.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, T-shirts, perfumes and accessories.  She's been in her communal bank for 3 years, and she likes it because with the loans she can buy merchandise more cheaply, which increases her profits. 

Maria's dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, perfumes and accessories

loans.name: Gema Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Gema, tiene 21 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene una hija de 3 años. Vive en casa de los padres. 

Doña Gema es una joven mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con su esfuerzo sacar adelante a su hija sin depender de nadie y es por eso ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catálogo, carteras y ciertos perfumes y bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, ella tiene 1 año con este negocio el cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución y por lo cual está muy agradecida, es así como se gana el sustento de ella y el de su hija.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, carteras, perfumes, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva un año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
  
Su sueño es que a su hija no le falte nada.
texts.en:
The “El Pedregal” communal bank meets every two weeks in El Pedregal in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.  Gema, 21, lives here.  She’s separated and has a three-year-old girl.  She lives in her parents’ house.  

Gema is a young woman who likes to fend for herself and with her efforts raise her daughter without depending on anyone else which is why she’s a merchant.  She sells clothes, purses, certain perfume and costume jewelry via catalogue door to door.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She’s been in business a year and started it with the first loan she got from the institution for which she’s very grateful; this is how she earns her livelihood for her and her daughter.

She will use this loan to buy clothes, purses, perfumes and other things she sells.  She’s been in the communal bank for a year and likes it because she started her business with the first loan.  Her dream is that her daughter lacks nothing.

loans.use: to buy clothes, purses, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El señor Jorge Alberto llego hace treinta años a esta ciudad fronteriza buscando una mejor calidad de vida y hasta la fecha lo ha estado logrando en base a muchos esfuerzos. El ha recibido apoyo de KIVA para su negocio de abarrotes, sus créditos anteriores han sido para la compra de mercancia con lo que ha incrementado sus ingresos. Ahora desea un nuevo crédito para la construcción de un cuarto donde planea extender su negocio y asi tener una vivienda más amplia y más cómoda donde radican él y su esposa. El señor Jorge se caracteriza por ser una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, emprendedora ya que aparte del negocio tiene un trabajo fijo en una agencia de importacion de vehículos, con los ingresos de ambas actividades planea pagar el crédito y darle mayor valor a su vivienda. El señor Jorge desea incrementar sus ganancias con la ayuda de su esposa quien le estará atendiendo su negocio mientras él trabaja y de esa manera asegurar un buen futuro cuando ellos ya no puedan trabajar.
texts.en: Jorge Alberto arrived at this border city thirty years ago seeking a better quality of life and to date has been attaining it by means of much effort.  He’s had Kiva help for his grocery store and has used his previous loans to buy merchandise that has led to an increase in his income.  Now, he wants a new loan to build a room where he plans to expand the business into to have a more spacious house his wife and he can live in.  Jorge is noted for being a very hardworking, responsible, enterprising person because besides having this business he also has a steady job in a vehicle importation firm.  He plans to repay the loan with income from both activities and increase his house’s value.  Jorge wants to increase his profits with help from his wife who will be tending to the business while he’s at work.  In this way, he insures a good future for them for when they are no longer able to work.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos, se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía.

En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad pero dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Jenny para ganar algo por su cuenta desde hace mas de 13 años tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí pasa la mayor parte del tiempo atendiendo su negocio, en las noches también vende ciertas bebidas y bocadillos que ella misma prepara ya en las noches su esposo le ayuda en su negocio, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 6h30 hasta las 22h00, los domingos solo trabaja hasta el medio día. Sus productos los compra en Portoviejo y otros los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para surtir aun más su tienda como arroz, azúcar, detergente, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva más de 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener su tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mejía” communal bank meet every two weeks in Mejía located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city dedicated in large part to agriculture and to growing and selling coconuts.  Jenny, 46, lives here.  She’s married and has four children who are all adults now but two still live at home.  Her husband works in agriculture.

To earn income of her own, Jenny has had a home-based grocery store for more than 13 years.  She spends most of her time there tending to the store.  At night, she also sells certain beverages and snacks she prepares herself and her husband helps her with the business at night.  She works Monday through Saturday from 6:30 in the morning until 10 at night and on Sundays only works a half-day.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo and some are delivered to her store.

This loan is to buy products like rice, sugar, detergent, among others to better stock her store with basic staples.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 6 years and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is to have a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Leifa Del Carmen

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos, se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía.

En este lugar vive la señora Leifa Del Carmen, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, ninguno de sus hijos vive con ella en la actualidad pero esta criando a un nieto de 7 años que estudia en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja en la agricultura.

Doña Leifa Del Carmen es una ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar ha tenido que dedicarse a la cría de pollos, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cada tres meses compra los pollitos y los cría por dos o tres meses y una vez que tengan un peso adecuado los vende ya sea en pie o por libras, entrega a comerciantes y también vende por su casa a vecinos del lugar, ella compra los pollos en una incubadora en Portoviejo, lleva más de 14 años dedicada a esto y le gusta porque se gana algo sin salir de su casa y con un trabajo mínimo.

Este crédito es para comprar más pollos y alimentos para los mismos ya que se viene la época de Navidad y Año Nuevo y en estos días se vende bastante y a buen precio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 9 años y le gusta porque la institución siempre cumple con las socias. 

Su sueño es tener otro galpón para tener más pollos.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mejía” communal bank meet every two weeks in Mejía located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city dedicated in large part to agriculture and to growing and selling coconuts.  Leifa Del Carmen, 49, lives here.  She’s married and has four children who are all adults now; none of them still live with her but she is raising her seven-year-old grandson who attends school.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Leifa Del Carmen is a housewife who in order to help cover household expenses has had to work raising chickens.  She has a small farm and every three months she buys chicks to raise for two to three months and once they reach adequate weight she sells them either live or by the pound.  She sells to merchants and also sells at home to her local neighbors.  She buys the chicks from an incubator in Portoviejo and has been in this line of work for more than 14 years; she likes it because she can earn a little without having to leave home and with a minimum of effort.

This loan is to buy more chicks and feed for them since the Christmas and New Year’s season is approaching and she sells quite a bit those days at good prices.  She’s been in the communal bank for 9 years and likes it because the institution always follows through with the members.  Her dream is to have another shed in order to house more chicks.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Laura Rocio

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos, se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía.

En este lugar vive la señora Laura, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 5 años de edad. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una joven madre que para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando tiene nueva mercadería. Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las tardes, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. La mercadería  se la trae su marido o se la envía desde los Estados Unidos ya que el viaja a menudo hasta ese país ya que es residente Americano. Ella lleva más de 2 años con este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos años y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
In Mejía, located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, a city of people dedicated in great measure to agriculture and the cultivation and sale of coconuts, the Mejía communal bank meets every fifteen days.

In this place lives Laura, who is 25 years old and has a common-law husband with whom she has one 5-year-old daughter. Her husband is a merchant. 
 
She is a young mother, and to obtain her own income, she dedicates herself to selling clothing of all types. Her sales method is door to door, and she also sells from her home, where her customers come to her when she has new merchandise. She works three days a week, above all in the evenings. She sells on credit to her customers and collects payments every fifteen days. The merchandise is brought by her husband or is sent from the United States, because he travels often to this country, since he is a U.S. resident. She has run this business for more than 2 years, and it is going very well for her. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank for two years, and she likes it because of the ease in obtaining loans. 

Her dream is to keep growing with her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Sarith, 51 years old, is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been running a business purchasing saplings (small trees) to resell, earning approximately $8 daily. His wife is a farmer who earns about $2 each day. Two of his children are employed, earning about $7 per day.

In order to improve his business, Sarith is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase more saplings to resell. He would thereby earn more income for his family. In the future, Sarith would like to expand his business and help his children receive a higher education. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more saplings to resell

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 42 years old, is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in fishing for more than seven years, earning approximately $8 daily. Sopheap's husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed, earning about $8 each day. Sopheap is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase zinc and timbers to fix some parts of her old house. This purchase will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, Sopheap would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase zinc and timbers to fix some parts of her house

loans.name: Arlan

texts.en:
Arlan didn't finish his college studies due to the early death of his step-father. He is indeed thankful to his step-father because without him, he wouldn't have been able to enter school. Arlan didn't lose his hopes of attaining his goal in life instead, it pushes him to strive hard to succeed.

Arlan both raises corn crops and livestock. Nowadays, he raised four animals which he fattened. Currently, his main priority is to increase the income he generates in order to support his children's education and have a viable source of income.

To make all these things possible, he is requesting a loan of PHP 45,000 which will allow him to buy livestock feed and to maintain his corn field. Arlan hopes for continuous financial support of the lenders to his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and maintain his corn-farming business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 57 years old, and is married to Tony. The couple is thankful, because they have been blessed with three children. To earn a living, Lolita is engaged in a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for five years and earns about PHP 300 a day. 

Lolita wants to restock her sari-sari store, but she lack the necessary capital. For this reason, Lolita is asking for a loan of an amount of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, biscuits and condiments to sell. Lolita hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, biscuits and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is from the village of Rizal. She is 46 years old, and is married with two children. To make a living, Elizabeth is engaged in a moving business: she usually sell snacks in their local community. She has been in this business for five years and earns a maximum of PHP 500 a day. 

Right now, Elizabeth is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy vegetables, native cakes and "balut" (fertilized duck eggs) to sell. Elizabeth hopes that she will increase her income, so that she will be able to continuously send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, native cakes and "balut" to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 39 years old, and is married with two children. They live in the village of Rizal. Jonalyn generates income with her husband. She has been engaged in a moving store business for one year and earns about PHP 350 a day. 

At this moment, Jonalyn is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 23,000 to buy vegetables, meat and fruits to sell. Jonalyn hopes to increase her income everyday to sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 49 years old, married and blessed with two children. Merlita lives in the village where she generates income. Merlita is engaged in selling fish. She has been in this business for two years and usually earns about PHP 1,500 a week. Merlita wants to have more fish to sell, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more variety of fish such us milk fish, "tilapia" and big head to sell. Merlita hopes to increase her income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old. She is married and has two children. To make a living, Nenita and her husband provide motorcycle transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 300 PHP daily. 

As of now, Nenita is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase oil, wheels and a new sprocket to improve her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase oil, wheels and a new sprocket to improve her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is from the village of Rizal. She generates income through her sari-sari store business. She is 42 years old and married with three children. She has been running her sari-sari store business for two years and earns about a minimum of PHP 250 a day. At this time, Erlinda is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, biscuits and other kitchen ingredients to sell. She believes that through her loan, she will be able to obtain more grocery items. She hopes that she will increase her income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, biscuits and other kitchen ingredients to sell

loans.name: Gemar

texts.en: Gemar is 25 years old and married to Cindilyn. To make a living, Gemar is engaged in the transportation business using his motorcycle. He has been in this business for three years and usually earns about PHP 300 a day. Right now, Gemar is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy oil, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He hopes that someday he can build another source of income to uplift his family from poor living.

loans.use: to buy oil, wheels and gasoline for his motorcycle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a widow with two children. Her eldest child has settled for marriage already and the youngest is still studying. It's been 20 years since her husband died due to hypertension.

Nancy doesn't only focus on selling various kinds of groceries.  Instead, she also offers different kinds of frozen foods to complete the basic commodities needed in her village. She would like to buy more stock of groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, junk foods and assorted biscuits for her variety store because Christmas season is approaching. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000. She hopes and prays that her variety store will flow smoothly so she can earn a better profit, which will enable her to improve their standard way of living and save for mergency purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, junk foods and assorted biscuits for her variety store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn's business focuses on making homemade vinegars, soy sauce and some native delicacies.She has been in this kind of business for four years. She is married with two children. Marilyn's husband works at Kraft Eden Cheese Company.

Marilyn's vinegar, soy sauce and native delicacies are marketed within her community and nearby municipality. She plans to buy more empty bottles and ingredients for her soy sauce and vinegar due to her many orders but she struggles because of a shortage of finances. So she is asking for a loan of PHP15,000. Marilyn hopes to take a loan to enable her to improve her way of living, educate her two children and improve the quality of products she sells in order for her to encourage more customers to buy her products and gain a better income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for vinegar and soy sauce and some empty bottles for her business

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel has been engaged in the livestock business, in particular raising hogs, for ten years. He is single and lives with his parents. Gabriel is the eldest child among his nine siblings.

Gabriel raises one sow and three piglets. He also cultivates the family's two hectares of corn field. Gabriel's main goal is to increase his yields next crop season and to make his hogs healthier upon reaching their maturity period. To make this dream come true, he is seeking a loan of  PHP 25,000 to buy sacks of hog feed and vitamins. He will use part of the loan to buy farm inputs to improve his corn crop production. Gabriel believes that his livestock business is under control because he has already undergone some difficulties and hardships in running a business. He hopes for continuous financial support from lenders in order to have a stable source of income and a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy sacks of hog feed, vitamins and farming inputs

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn, 50 years old, is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing vegetables to sell for more than seven years, earning approximately $2 daily. Phorn's husband runs a motor taxi service, earning about $3 each day. Three of her children are employed, earning about $9 per day.

Due to her family’s transportation difficulties, Phorn is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help reduce the family's transportation expenses. In the future, Phorn would like to expand her business and help her youngest child get a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en: Sokea, 24 years old, is single and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been running a hair salon for more than a year, earning approximately $6 per day. In order to improve her business, Sokea is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more equipment to use in the shop. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to use in the shop

loans.name: Kim Leng

texts.en: Kim Leang (shown in the picture with her daughter) is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Kim Leang has been involved in cultivating rice and raising animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a business purchasing and reselling cattle, earning about $5 daily. Kim Leang is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to use for farming. This purchase will help her crops grow well and provide high yields. In the future, Kim Leang would like to expand her farming business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Bunnat

texts.en:
Bunnat is 34 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is an arc welder who earns about $6 per day.

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning about $4 daily.  Because of the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Bunnat is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan, 41 years old, is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and raising animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory, earning about $12 each day. Khan is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds for farming. This money will help her crops grow well and provide higher yields. In the future, Khan would like to expand her business and help her youngest child get a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Rimsom Florent 1Er Jumeau

texts.fr:
Mr  RIMSOM FLORENT  est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est étudiant en classe de licence III professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  3ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle.  Il envisage après les  études  travailler.
texts.en:
Rimson Florent is single and has no children. He is a student in his third year of a professional degree program at ESTPO (the Ouagadougou University of Public Works), and has been on this course for three years. He is studying here because the ESTPO is a leading school in the field of civil engineering studies in the country. He plans to finance his higher education studies. 

Rimson Florent carries out practical work experience placements during the holidays, because he wants to gain professional experience. He plans to work once he finishes his studies.

loans.use: to finance his higher education studies.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 24 years old and married to a construction worker. She and her spouse are happy, because they have been blessed with a healthy child. 

Karen is a hog raiser within her local community of Sto. Domingo.  Aside from livestock, she is also engaged in fish-vending as an additional source of income.

Karen would like to ensure proper growth of her hogs, but her capital is insufficient, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 for additional working capital.  This will allow her to buy livestock feed, vitamins and vaccine. 

She knows that when she has these necessary livestock supplies, she could obtain a better income for her family needs, and savings for a bright future for her only child.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed, vitamins and vaccine for her hogs.

loans.name: Winsom Florentin 2Ème Jumeau

texts.fr:
Mr  W FLORENTIN  est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est étudiant en classe de licence III professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  3ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle.  Il envisage après les  études  travailler et se marier.
texts.en:
W Florentin is single and has no children. He is a student in his third year of a professional degree program at the ESTPO (the Ouagadougou University of Public Works), and has been on this course for three years. He is studying here because the ESTPO is a leading school in the field of civil engineering studies in the country. He plans to finance his higher education studies. 

W Florentin carries out practical work experience placements during the holidays, because he wants to gain professional experience. After his studies he plans to work and get married.

loans.use: to finance his higher education studies.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 31 years old, married with 3 children. She is a responsible mother who supported her husband in generating income. 

She has been buying and selling plastic wares in the public market for almost 10 years. Despite the problems and difficulties she has encountered in life, she is confident in pursueing her business in order to generate sufficient income. 

She aims to further improve the business to increase her income in order to acquire the necessities, and finance the education of their children. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP18,000.00 to buy more stock of plastic wares, bags, toys, belts and umbrellas for sale. 

Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands. She is hoping that someday, she will make more improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic wares, bags, toys, belts and umbrellas for sale.

loans.name: Hermann Rakiswende

texts.fr:
Mr  HERMANE RAKISWENDE  est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est étudiant en classe de licence III professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  3ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
